commit_message:
Set correct start for the timeframe.

We mistakenly used quuens-RC1 which is really the beginning of the rocky
cycle.  Set the start date to be the pike-rc1 branch point which is when
master branches opened up for queens development.

Change-Id: I1c27d10de14595346756892e22a1e14f3168cb85

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-15 21:29:29.000000000', 'message': "OCP-Router: Fix path route to support subpath

OCP-Route supports path based routes, path based routes specify a path
component that can be compared against a URL such that multiple routes
can be served using the same host name, each with a different path.

Assuming that OCP-Route object that maps hostname:'www.test.com',
path:'/path', to service named: 'target_service' was created.
We should expect that all URL starts with  'www.test.com/path' should
be routed to 'target_service' pods.

This patch updates ocp-route handler to support the above requirement.

Change-Id: I95df37663fc7016f81ebf7b9683779e023b6d24c
Closes-Bug: 1781828
"}, {'created': '2018-07-23 15:11:55.000000000', 'message': "OCP-Router: Fix path route to support subpath

component that can be compared against a URL such that multiple routes
can be served using the same host name, each with a different path.

Assuming that OCP-Route object that maps hostname:'www.test.com',

We should expect that all URL starts with  'www.test.com/path' should

"}]
commit_message:
OCP-Router: Fix path route to support subpath

OCP-Route supports path based routes, path based routes specify a path
component that can be compared against a URL such that multiple routes
can be served using the same host name, each with a different path.

Assuming that OCP-Route object that maps hostname:'www.test.com',
path:'/path', to service named: 'target_service' was created.
We should expect that all URL starts with  'www.test.com/path' should
be routed to 'target_service' pods.

This patch updates ocp-route handler to support the above requirement.

Change-Id: I95df37663fc7016f81ebf7b9683779e023b6d24c
Closes-Bug: 1781828

commit_message:
mimic: pass --no-mon-config for osd config

Ensure that local configuration files are used for all
settings, instead of mon set configuration which requires
access to the mon cluster which may not be running at the
point in time that configuration is required.

Change-Id: I1fa80c78d6e6e501848d14098fe88d0df4f9e8bc

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 16:45:43.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I317540f293dfb65b3010cafa5aa97e6e9c3c92f9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I317540f293dfb65b3010cafa5aa97e6e9c3c92f9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Hai <nguyentrihai93@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ifb8977e8aa32ae4802bc81bfd4c2516663688fb4
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove references to `pki` and `pkiz` tokens in templates

The functionality was removed from charm in commit
17b24e7fde8e4c8c276a4f392cbae0d1d0ed2615

Template references was left behind and this commit addresses
that.

Change-Id: I55362faec21f32cccdcb82f810680b70fe2fb53b

commit_message:
mimic: Sync charms.ceph for misc fixes

Ensures mon cluster is not queried early in unit lifecycle
when the cluster is not bootstrapped or accessible by the
ceph-osd unit.

Block device sizes are set in local config so querying the
monitor is OK to skip.

Change-Id: Iea37455b0946560056ee665e819ee0a2a4a7832c

commit_message:
Add "interface_type" field in deployable DB

The added "interface_type" field represents deployables' interface
type when attaching to the hypervisor, e.g pci,mdev etc.
When "interface_type" equals "pci", the "address" field represents
the pci_address, and  when "interface_type" equals "mdev", the
"address" field represents mdev_path.

Change-Id: I9acbecab2aa8741e9aa7f19f7543a5c05defd90b

subject: Fluent-logging: Update default fluentbit configuration
messages: [{'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2018-07-13 14:38:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-07-25 12:32:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2018-07-25 13:48:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 14:38:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fluent-logging: Update default fluentbit configuration

As of 0.12.14, fluentbit exposes a flag for setting the db_sync
behavior for writing the location of the tail input to its sqlite
database. The default setting is Full, which introduces additional
synchronizations before and after a transaction. This has the
potential to negatively affect disk performance with the extra
synchronizations. This moves the setting in the chart to Normal,
which performs fewer synchronizations and still maintains a high
level of safety with status writes

Change-Id: I3b437edd6bd7501ef37ce06f0a561bd1747eb290
'}]
commit_message:
Fluent-logging: Update default fluentbit configuration

As of 0.12.14, fluentbit exposes a flag for setting the db_sync
behavior for writing the location of the tail input to its sqlite
database. The default setting is Full, which introduces additional
synchronizations before and after a transaction. This has the
potential to negatively affect disk performance with the extra
synchronizations. This moves the setting in the chart to Normal,
which performs fewer synchronizations and still maintains a high
level of safety with status writes

Change-Id: I3b437edd6bd7501ef37ce06f0a561bd1747eb290

commit_message:
Allow custom --bip CIDR for docker options

The default docker0 brige should be normally given a
value that does not conflict to any of the existing
networks' CIDR ranges.

If there is a conflict for the default value `172.31.0.1/24`,
allow users to alter the the docker service startup ``--bip``
option via ``DockerNetworkOptions``.

Change-Id: I9b3e729ba48811415106c9fa460cd5a677067fb7
Closes-Bug: #1783271
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 06c66972259482819e5e0705104ebc7d9a14e8ff)

today which requires ruby >= 2.3.0 that CentOS does not provide.

[1] https://github.com/davissp14/etcdv3-ruby/issues/120

Change-Id: Ie3299691c63ef02a64d8c138ee2f833a3ef262b1

commit_message:
Disable etcdv3, lock net-telnet and bump version

The etcdv3 gem was added so we could introduced etcd support
in the openstacklib module however this has not been started yet
and this gem is blocking ruby 2.5.0 support because it depends
on an older version of the grpc gem.

This comments this dependency and adds a note to fix this later.
The issue has been reported upstream here [1] and is blocking
Ubuntu Bionic beaker tests.

This also locks net-telnet to 0.1.1 because 0.2.0 was just released
today which requires ruby >= 2.3.0 that CentOS does not provide.

[1] https://github.com/davissp14/etcdv3-ruby/issues/120

Change-Id: Ie3299691c63ef02a64d8c138ee2f833a3ef262b1

Update host_maintenance doc

Before we stored flavors in instance_extra, certain fields, defined
in nova.compute.flavors.system_metadata_flavor_props, were stored
in the instance.system_metadata for the embedded instance.flavor.
The "disabled" field wasn't one of those keys, however, so really
old instances that had their embedded flavor converted to the

set and we need to default those here so callers, like the

instance.flavor.disabled.

'}]
commit_message:
Default embedded instance.flavor.disabled attribute

Before we stored flavors in instance_extra, certain fields, defined
in nova.compute.flavors.system_metadata_flavor_props, were stored
in the instance.system_metadata for the embedded instance.flavor.
The "disabled" field wasn't one of those keys, however, so really
old instances that had their embedded flavor converted to the
serialized instance_extra form won't have the disabled attribute
set and we need to default those here so callers, like the
versioned notfication FlavorPayload, don't explode trying to load
instance.flavor.disabled.

Change-Id: I72f8c11b8b2df1416dec8e2d9250eac0693a30e9
Closes-Bug: #1739325
(cherry picked from commit 8df21c1e5fc46f2774a7653e1c9a4c2ac0b5dbfd)
(cherry picked from commit b2146b02a943c784b6c6fe19ec9e5247bd8e503d)

commit_message:
Use class-level skips when necessary

This commit switches @skipUnless decorator to class-level skips in
TestKuryrRestartScenario and TestPortPoolScenario. This way we're not
wasting time to do setUp and tearDown for a class that will run no tests.

Change-Id: Iebac5953c5d615da68ab0237fc09e0deebc65e85

commit_message:
Add support for conductor groups

Implements support for conductor groups when creating, updating and
listing nodes. Refactored some CLI code to avoid excessive copy-paste.

Change-Id: I16559bc3bb6dcbac996c768aa4514676cf4a98a8
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/581391/
Story: #2001795
Task: #23117

subject: Replace the deleted keypair in clusters for API v2
messages:
[{'account_id': 27576, 'date': '2018-02-01 08:23:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-02-16 18:36:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We should only support updating the cluster with existing keypairs. What I mean is: this update keypair API should take only the id of a nova keypair, not the actual "ssh-rsa" string.

Also, I wonder if we need to actual update the heat stack to reflect the keypair change? What if we update the keypair but then using scaling to grow the cluster? I think in that case only the old keypair will be added'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-02-19 14:22:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree with jeremy that we should update with an existing keypair, the rest of his comment I'm not sure about it"}, {'account_id': 27576, 'date': '2018-02-22 02:25:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Say thanks to Jeremy and Telles, I got it.I will update the cluster only with existing keypairs.

For Jeremy's doubt, I mean: when we scale the cluster which search the keypair by the id, but we may inadvertently delete the keypair in nova. we should use a new keypair to replace the old keypair and write into the cluster's  "authorized_keys" files.'}, {'account_id': 27576, 'date': '2018-02-22 05:56:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-06-08 15:43:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Okay-- I finally tested it: the code works fine! :D

(When I tried {"keypair": true} in cluster PATCH body, the keypair was successfully appended to all instances. When I tried cluster scaling, the new instances successfully received the new keypair.)


Some thought: The feature is very weird. It relies on the user deleting their old keypair and then creating a new keypair with the exact same name. Can you please write some documentation (and maybe link to the documentation in the release note) explaining the procedure for how keypair replacement works?'}, {'account_id': 27576, 'date': '2018-06-11 08:00:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27576, 'date': '2018-06-11 09:15:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27576, 'date': '2018-06-11 10:55:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27576, 'date': '2018-06-12 01:28:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-06-12 18:31:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27576, 'date': '2018-06-13 01:55:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-07-25 08:31:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

I think we should merge it before freeze. I have some documentation concerns but they can come a bit later'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-07-25 11:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Replace the deleted keypair in clusters for API v2

This commit allows users to create a new keypair to access to
the running cluster when the cluster's keypair is deleted. But
the name of new keypair should be same as the deleted one, and
the new keypair is available for cluster scaling.
we can implement it via update_keypair parameter.

Change-Id: I3bc0ba52ceebff8ae128321aeb9fdbb5769baaf5
Closes-Bug:#1745142

commit_message:
snmp: Keep get_next method backward-compatible

get_next() method used to get values under scope of a given OID before
high-level API was introduced. This patch makes this method work as
before since iRMC inspection depends on this behavior.

Change-Id: I3b5abc2e7df9283086265df090f23890a409bc1d

[{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-07 20:43:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-05-07 23:09:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-05-08 03:21:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Julia, this patch does not seem to help. I tried building both Ubuntu and Debian image with the addition of iscsi-boot element. The end result is the same as before. Ended up with this error again.

"ALERT!  LABEL=cloudimg-rootfs does not exist.  Dropping to a shell!"

I did boot up the images with 'qemu-system-x86_64' and I can tell that this patch was indeed applied correctly. So there's still an issue with finding the correct root file system label it seems.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-05-08 23:40:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I finally able to get it ubuntu working in devstack by using the instructions here.

http://etherboot.org/wiki/sanboot/ubuntu_iscsi2

I'll push up the changes for your reference."}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-05-08 23:50:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-05-08 23:51:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-13 12:52:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-13 12:57:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-05-13 12:58:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Adding derek since he has a clue of any dracut based boot changes that may be needed.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-05-15 19:05:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2018-05-28 16:38:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Using this element on centos I got an error (inline)

By the looks of it almost all of this isn't required on Centos7, the only thing currently needed to change in a DIB generated centos image  is to add "rd.iscsi.firmware=1 " to the kernel command line. iscsi-initiator-utils already gets installed by the base element and the iscsi dracut module now appears to now be part of the default ramdisk.'}, {'account_id': 1926, 'date': '2018-05-30 15:24:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-01 17:13:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

Marking WF -1, Seems like we should abandon this given an alternative element landed.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-07-02 16:06:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Marking WF -1, Seems like we should abandon this given an
 > alternative element landed.

Yeah I agree. Though I haven't had a chance to validate the latest element. I have been wondering around in Ironic multi-tenancy land the past few weeks. :-)"}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-07-25 13:54:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Marking Abandoned.'}]

commit_message:
Add simple iscsi-boot element

Add an element to help disk images load the
necessary items to boot from a remote iscsi
volume.

Co-Authored-By: Guang Yee <guang.yee@suse.com>
Change-Id: I5f4a090a67ccbd58cf760124eb08fbd81a53be40

commit_message:
Move port from_idl from ovsport to ovs impl_idl

The only place that uses the code that creates a port instance from the
ovsdb data is actually in the ovsdb/impl_idl, this is ovs specific code,
so it should reside there and not in the code where the port is defined.

Change-Id: Ieaec525487381000a1b0019037b8bedaa7b50f04
Partial-Bug: #1781376

commit_message:
Add keystoneauth options to list_opts

The [service_user] group contains keystoneauth's session
options as well. This patch add these options back to list_opts.

both OIR and tolerations actually. OIR to keep accounting of current availability and tolerations to create dedicated nodes for efficient use of resources."}, {'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2017-07-03 08:21:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Thanks Vikas! I like the overall approach. I just have some questions, so I think the spec can be make more clear by:
- Give some examples of the network objects events that will be watched
- Give more information about the new handler. What actions will perform for the network object events.
- For the subnet driver, I would include information about how the information will be passed at the pod and how it will be handled. 
- At the last point in kuryr controller changes, perhaps a diagram could help too.
- At the la'}, {'account_id': 15168, 'date': '2017-07-03 09:27:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

one thing I do not entirely understand/like here is the assumption, that a k8s namespace would map to neutron network(not subnet). This means that It would be impossible to get interfaces from 2 networks onto the same Pod. This looks like an unnecessary limitation to me. Am I not seeing something?'}, {'account_id': 6598, 'date': '2017-07-03 14:06:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Multi-Network support

There is already work going by Kirill and Luis on multi-vif and
optional subnets already. Here i have come up with a approach on how
to tie up above works with multi-network support.

Targets bp: multi-network

Change-Id: I4362f3b360a57a90b3d53407ad8c6a64b66b4d00

commit_message:
Fix requirements version for Flask

Since Flask version was globally updated to the latest version,
the project's requirements need update too.

At the moment this is blocking any other updates to project's
requirements as the requirement-check job is failing.

Change-Id: I47d0a90a1f7224a3e81896aa94039918403d4f0c

commit_message:
Add unshelve instance error info to fault table

When the image of the SHELVED_OFFLOADED instance is deleted, the unshelve
instance will report an error, but the fault info not added into instance
fault table.

Closes-bug: #1779826

Change-Id: I365fcc148b27959acad1d3c4f8bb45c1ed790318
(cherry picked from commit b26df4fa6cd78a9b60de79750d4e9a58980d13ca)

commit_message:
Trusts do not implement patch.

We do not actually implement patch. This is not part of our API and
this isn't testing anything specifically relevant. In Flask this
is 405. This is not an API contract break, as being unimplemneted
it is the responsibility of the underlying server to handle the
request.

Change-Id: I42975afa71ea083653bcbe582879b5c3c0dfb3ef
Partial-Bug: #1776504

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 20:39:32.000000000', 'message': "Allow for 'extension' rel in json home

Allow providing an alternative REL function (e.g. for extensions)
in JSON Home in flask. The alternative functions are expected to
be functools.partial.

The extension-mode should only ever be used in the case of a keystone
API that was an extension (legacy style) and has not been converted
over to a new URI path; typically extensions start with an OS- prefix
in the URL.

All new APIs should not be using the 'extension' style.

Change-Id: I3970aef12f3b7c8e84fa80dfea8fc6eda63fe77d
Partial-Bug: #1776504
"}, {'created': '2018-07-17 21:04:39.000000000', 'message': "Allow for 'extension' rel in json home

Partial-Bug: #1776504
"}]
commit_message:
Allow for 'extension' rel in json home

Allow providing an alternative REL function (e.g. for extensions)
in JSON Home in flask. The alternative functions are expected to
be functools.partial.

The extension-mode should only ever be used in the case of a keystone
API that was an extension (legacy style) and has not been converted
over to a new URI path; typically extensions start with an OS- prefix
in the URL.

All new APIs should not be using the 'extension' style.

Change-Id: I3970aef12f3b7c8e84fa80dfea8fc6eda63fe77d
Partial-Bug: #1776504

[{'created': '2018-07-24 16:27:33.000000000', 'message': 'Allow to change the version of API also for CLI tests

The tempest.conf configuration key data-processing.saharaclient.version
was renamed to api_version_saharaclient; the old name is still accepted.
More important, the variable controls also the version of the API
used for CLI tests, not only for tempest.lib-based client tests.

The signature of ClientTestBase.openstack changes a bit (no more *args
and **kwargs) but it should not cause any regression, because the
method only passes the parameters to the corresponding function
from tempest.lib.cli, which accepts that specific set of arguments.

Change-Id: I2034591f9f336100b2eb3c0e42e4b94227c90625
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to change the version of API also for CLI tests

The tempest.conf configuration key data-processing.saharaclient.version
was renamed to api_version_saharaclient; the old name is still accepted.
More important, the variable controls also the version of the API
used for CLI tests, not only for tempest.lib-based client tests.

The signature of ClientTestBase.openstack changes a bit (no more *args
and **kwargs) but it should not cause any regression, because the
method only passes the parameters to the corresponding function
from tempest.lib.cli, which accepts that specific set of arguments.

Change-Id: I2034591f9f336100b2eb3c0e42e4b94227c90625

commit_message:
Add support for using distribution packages for OpenStack services

Distributions provide packages for the OpenStack services so we add
support for using these instead of the pip ones.

Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
Change-Id: Ie6eeff541a319967715e619dcdc26177aec5be72

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-20 08:39:40.000000000', 'message': "Use isolated

We moved to use pypi to install rally, but we didn't remove
the pins, nor use isolated.

This is a problem because the repo_build could have built a series
of packages which are common to a different role.
In this case, ansible gets pulled by ceph-ansible, and by rally.

The ansible version pulled by ceph-ansible is in [1], which
would resolve this day to ansible 2.4.4.0.
The ansible wheel built would not match the one pinned in the
rally role.

The repo server serves the packages locally if a local package
exists for the same name, and relies on pypi otherwise.

When the repo server builds the virtualenv, the venv creation
for rally fails, as the repo server wants to serve the ceph-ansible
built version of ansible, and not the 2.4.3.0 asked by rally.

The best way to fix this is with a multiple series of patches:
1 Ensure the repo server can serve all the versions of a package,
  by pointing to upstream if a specific version was requested
2 Temporarily ensure the rally installation is ignoring the
  constraints of other packages, and installing the packages
  without being limited by the repository server
3 Remove the unnecessary pin, to follow rally's recommended
  version.
4 Ensure the rally installation version is installed with
  the matching upstream repo constraints [2].
5 Ensure ceph-ansible's requirements are not installed on
  the destination node, nor built into the repo-server.

This handles the 2) case, and starts the 3) work.
A follow-up patch should be included to ensure 4) is done,
ensuring the ansible pin setup in this patch can be removed.

[1]: https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/blob/f68936ca7e7f556c8d8cee8b2c4565a3c94f72f9/requirements.txt
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/rally/blob/0.12.1/upper-constraints.txt

Change-Id: I476bd2ae645aa5e0628924b631c4cc4cba4c93d8

commit_message:
Use isolated

We moved to use pypi to install rally, but we didn't remove
the pins, nor use isolated.

This is a problem because the repo_build could have built a series
of packages which are common to a different role.
In this case, ansible gets pulled by ceph-ansible, and by rally.
Indeed, ceph-ansible has recently added requirements into
their repository [3].

The ansible version pulled by ceph-ansible is in [1], which
would resolve this day to ansible 2.4.4.0.
The ansible wheel built would not match the one pinned in the
rally role.

The repo server serves the packages locally if a local package
exists for the same name, and relies on pypi otherwise.

When the repo server builds the virtualenv, the venv creation
for rally fails, as the repo server wants to serve the ceph-ansible
built version of ansible, and not the 2.4.3.0 asked by rally.

The best way to fix this is with a multiple series of patches:
1 Ensure the repo server can serve all the versions of a package,
  by pointing to upstream if a specific version was requested
2 Temporarily ensure the rally installation is ignoring the
  constraints of other packages, and installing the packages
  without being limited by the repository server
3 Remove the unnecessary pin, to follow rally's recommended
  version.
4 Ensure the rally installation version is installed with
  the matching upstream repo constraints [2].
5 Ensure ceph-ansible's requirements are not installed on
  the destination node, nor built into the repo-server.

This handles the 2) case, and starts the 3) work.
A follow-up patch should be included to ensure 4) is done,
ensuring the ansible pin setup in this patch can be removed.

[1]: https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/blob/f68936ca7e7f556c8d8cee8b2c4565a3c94f72f9/requirements.txt
[2]: https://github.com/openstack/rally/blob/0.12.1/upper-constraints.txt
[3]: https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/commit/ef48ed4e5af10f93f7bcf6d19ab48143554f2038#diff-b4ef698db8ca845e5845c4618278f29a

Change-Id: I476bd2ae645aa5e0628924b631c4cc4cba4c93d8

commit_message:
Fixing Octavia generating json named file containing yaml

Currently when the command to generate a policy file is used, it will
generate a yaml based file, but call it json.sample.policy. This patch
forces it to generate a json file, and changes the default name to
policy.json.sample.

Change-Id: I4d04f4f37385bd4601f566238aaba43dcbe74780

We currently make no provision for the chair to be able to delegate or
otherwise share their responsibilities. This change defines a new vice
chair role to give us a way to designate someone to act in a
supporting role for the active chair and to take over in the chair's
absence so that business does not need to halt when the chair is

commit_message:
add vice chair role to the tc charter

We currently make no provision for the chair to be able to delegate or
otherwise share their responsibilities. This change defines a new vice
chair role to give us a way to designate someone to act in a
supporting role for the active chair and to take over in the chair's
absence so that business does not need to halt when the chair is
unavailable.

Change-Id: I3e520eb0d900bc3d0552afbb5bcb9fd13fd0d09c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Delete image residual data

When use‚Äúzun pull‚Äú to pull image, the image is considered that
it can be managed by zun and the image is recorded in DB image
table. These image is allowed to be delete by client.

Those images that pulled when create container are considered
that they can not be managed by zun, because they were not
recorded in the DB image table. These images can be cleaned
by period task.

When delete the images managed by zun that pulled from glance,
delete the tar file and then delete the image loaded in docker.

Change-Id: I9d1e45af862dad26337047f5f6056d1d8aa5def8
Partial-Implements: blueprint delete-image-residual-data

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 18:48:51.000000000', 'message': 'copy ceph config in manila-share container bundle

The pacemaker manila-share docker configuration was
set up on the assumption that /etc/ceph on the host
is bind-mounted directly to /etc/ceph in the manila-share
container, but since [1] this is no longer true.  Ceph
configuration follows the pattern wherein the ceph
configuration and keys are bind-mounted into the container
at /var/lib/kolla/config_files/src-ceph/.

So set the docker kolla config for the pacemaker
bundled manila share to copy the contents of
/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src-ceph to /etc/ceph in
the container as is done in the non-pacemaker service
and as is done with cinder-volume service with both
the pacemaker and non-pacemaker versions of the
service.

Closes-Bug: #1783149

[1] I66a76d3226d5a1d3e0b5387326305d1f3313a340

Change-Id: If6cb5e7bd0a5d7952ab43dffddb0e8eaf4952a0d
(cherry picked from commit ba5a57831a43477afc4edecbaf3d33638830496e)
'}]
commit_message:
copy ceph config in manila-share container bundle

The pacemaker manila-share docker configuration was
set up on the assumption that /etc/ceph on the host
is bind-mounted directly to /etc/ceph in the manila-share
container, but since [1] this is no longer true.  Ceph
configuration follows the pattern wherein the ceph
configuration and keys are bind-mounted into the container
at /var/lib/kolla/config_files/src-ceph/.

So set the docker kolla config for the pacemaker
bundled manila share to copy the contents of
/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src-ceph to /etc/ceph in
the container as is done in the non-pacemaker service
and as is done with cinder-volume service with both
the pacemaker and non-pacemaker versions of the
service.

Closes-Bug: #1783149

[1] I66a76d3226d5a1d3e0b5387326305d1f3313a340

Change-Id: If6cb5e7bd0a5d7952ab43dffddb0e8eaf4952a0d
(cherry picked from commit ba5a57831a43477afc4edecbaf3d33638830496e)

commit_message:
[WIP] Add a profile for kolla nova

Add a new selector profile to easily install all the packages required
to use nova with kolla-ansible.

Also update the centos base image to enable the 'centos-qemu-ev'
repository which contains up to date qemu related packages.

Change-Id: Ie11e6983d9043ae82d4c9da3251c32095fd6808d

[{'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-07-23 08:53:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-07-24 08:27:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Looks good. How about adding a test that serializes a context object, then deserializes and checks that that its state is correct?'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-07-24 13:43:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-07-25 10:14:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-07-25 10:52:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM. But bare in mind that changing the way the context is passed between the engine and the executors may already be exploited by custom actions. We need to be very careful while implementing this transition as there are custom actions that use the context as it is today. Changing to ActionContext can be a breaking change.'}]

commit_message:
Make the ActionContext serializable

Currently if Mistral needs to pass the ActionContext  via it's internal
rpc calls it wont be serialised. This change should have no end-user
impact, but makes it easier for Mistral to use internally.

Change-Id: I238355d52c77d622740527e43ddb2b7484cc58db

we need to use the 'force' parameter to force the symlink creation.

Change-Id: I05eb9026707639aa12ea1c3ae93b872191528069

[{'created': '2018-07-24 15:21:51.000000000', 'message': 'Restore execution of plugin tests

When commit 52634f55fdab470492ed68095e8f465e173a909c changed the
directory structure, it also deleted blazar/tests/plugins/__init__.py.
As a result, all tests under blazar/tests/plugins/ where skipped. This
patch restores this file to resume executing plugin tests.

Change-Id: I47eec42fd1d51d21c6abc53100b8785c766bf863
'}]
commit_message:
Restore execution of plugin tests

When commit 52634f55fdab470492ed68095e8f465e173a909c changed the
directory structure, it also deleted blazar/tests/plugins/__init__.py.
As a result, all tests under blazar/tests/plugins/ where skipped. This
patch restores this file to resume executing plugin tests.

Change-Id: I47eec42fd1d51d21c6abc53100b8785c766bf863

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-23 08:49:42.000000000', 'message': 'Change all tests to use the standard addCleanup

Currently a lot of tests are using a custom self.store() method to
perform automatic cleanup on tearDown.
We should change to the standard addCleanup method that is being called
on every object (also if setUp fails and tearDown is not called).
See [1] for details.

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#unittest.TestCase.addCleanup

Change-Id: Ic62dd9a5e07435d1179793ec2c5cdc6e4eddef60
'}, {'created': '2018-07-23 09:23:36.000000000', 'message': 'Change all tests to use the standard addCleanup

Currently a lot of tests are using a custom self.store() method to
perform automatic cleanup on tearDown.
We should change to the standard addCleanup method that is being called
on every object (also if setUp fails and tearDown is not called).
See [1] for details.

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#unittest.TestCase.addCleanup

Change-Id: Ic62dd9a5e07435d1179793ec2c5cdc6e4eddef60
'}]
commit_message:
Change all tests to use the standard addCleanup

Currently a lot of tests are using a custom self.store() method to
perform automatic cleanup on tearDown.
We should change to the standard addCleanup method that is being called
on every object (also if setUp fails and tearDown is not called).
See [1] for details.

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html#unittest.TestCase.addCleanup

Change-Id: Ic62dd9a5e07435d1179793ec2c5cdc6e4eddef60

commit_message:
Rename OVS INTERFACE constants to PORT INTERFACE

These constants are generic and are relevant to any switch backend we
will use. The current name is probably because of historical reasons.

Change-Id: I15ce23580daba0c3b2682d9bf0233b9298b1e642
Partial-Bug: #1781376

commit_message:
tasks: horizon_post_install: Ensure horizon dashboard directory is accessible

During the DB migration step, the horizon user needs full access to the
directory so we need to ensure that all the permissions are set
correctly before we reach that point.

Change-Id: I52933cf52b33bf81a2cee2f18665a1760760b08f

[{'created': '2018-07-25 08:36:24.000000000', 'message': "Add blazar.tests.plugins.__init__.py

The directory structure change, Ib5ae4e291a9e47459f7aeee3d7570688bd8b1648
moves test files under plugin directory to each plugin's directory.
It results in two directories, blazar.tests.plugins.oshost and
blazar.tests.plugins.instances, are out of scope for its unit test.

This patch adds blazar.tests.plugins.__init__.py file to represent
the directory and directories under it as a test directory.

Change-Id: I2f801532a369f57a4de6f636f5460841c022532b
"}]
commit_message:
Add blazar.tests.plugins.__init__.py

The directory structure change, Ib5ae4e291a9e47459f7aeee3d7570688bd8b1648
moves test files under plugin directory to each plugin's directory.
It results in two directories, blazar.tests.plugins.oshost and
blazar.tests.plugins.instances, are out of scope for its unit test.

This patch adds blazar.tests.plugins.__init__.py file to represent
the directory and directories under it as a test directory.

Change-Id: I2f801532a369f57a4de6f636f5460841c022532b

commit_message:
vitrage driver keep deactivated alarms

instead of deleting deactivated alarms right away, keep them around
for a time until clean-up. It is helpful for Congress to have
reference to alarms that have been resolved and the information
regarding them.

Change-Id: I664e3fcfaf232f0bd938ac8ba684aee3310b1aa1

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-12-17 16:24:22.000000000', 'message': 'pass empty image id to nova when create instance from volume

Pass a image id to nova when creating a instance from volume is
weird and inconsistent with normal instance creation by Horzion.

Besides, it is hard for outside-nova projects to judge whether the
instance is boot from volume which may cause some side effects.

Change-Id: I48a7135d32a2b1cd75ab10aa28941033a5b1280b
Co-Authored-By: Hao Li <lihao@cmss.chinamobile.com>
Closes-Bug: #1527305
'}]
commit_message:
pass empty image id to nova when create instance from volume

Pass a image id to nova when creating a instance from volume is
weird and inconsistent with normal instance creation by Horzion.

Besides, it is hard for outside-nova projects to judge whether the
instance is boot from volume which may cause some side effects.

Change-Id: I48a7135d32a2b1cd75ab10aa28941033a5b1280b
Co-Authored-By: Hao Li <lihao@cmss.chinamobile.com>
Closes-Bug: #1527305

commit_message:
Remove pypy job

The pypy job never worked and nobody contributed on making
it better.

We should remove it until people are explicitly wanting to
improve the situation.

Change-Id: I680b2c07f867db828774e906b6743e3957a40364

commit_message:
correct the status of firewall group when restart l3 agent

when restart l3 agent,the add_route will be use by l3 agent extensions manager,,but in it _has_port_insertion_fields check,the "add_port_ids" in firewall group will be empty list when the group is not associated with any route interface,and then the status will be changed and notify to plugin

Change-Id: Ib86d798e0d167f258bbac02ef17fea87ae4ebbd1
Closes-Bug: #1783327

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

To install horizon, check python3 version and set target directory
in postinstall script on package.json.

Change-Id: I181b2a204f6998c24aa188b83a66c596cfb44f1c
Co-Authored-By: Shu Muto <shu.mutow@gmail.com>

commit_message:
update requirements for neutron-lib 1.18.0

Neutron-lib 1.18.0 is our Rocky RC and is already being used by neutron
[1]. This patch updates the neutron-lib required version to match
neutron [1] in prep for the Rocky release.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583671/

Change-Id: I128727d39decd8215059798aace788ff5b1ecf0e

commit_message:
Fix "instance snap min disk size err after resize instance"

After resize instance, image_min_disk of instance system
meta was not updated by root_gb of new flavor. Then we
create snap of this instance and create new instances by
the snap with smaller than the new flavor. Finally, we
fail to create new instances.

So that, this commit aims to update the image_min_disk.

Change-Id: Iac841a6c7facd9fa4c20276d4fb86577483b0523
Closes-Bug: #1771262

[{'created': '2018-06-27 10:12:52.000000000', 'message': 'Change default horizon_server_name to ansible_fqdn

horizon_server_name setting in apache config file must be a FQDN
otherwise when debug mode is enabled, HTTP requests without a
host: header (such as haproxy health checks) fail with a message
about invaid domain name.

Change-Id: I8672593019e4cc5cf6144c40359ecb9d64bc9224
Closes-Bug: #1778085
'}]
commit_message:
Change default horizon_server_name to ansible_fqdn

horizon_server_name setting in apache config file must be a FQDN
otherwise when debug mode is enabled, HTTP requests without a
host: header (such as haproxy health checks) fail with a message
about invaid domain name.

Change-Id: I8672593019e4cc5cf6144c40359ecb9d64bc9224
Closes-Bug: #1778085

commit_message:
Replace os-client-config to openstacksdk

Since now os-client-config has been superceded by openstacksdk[1].
So need to replace the os-client-config in zaqarclient to
slove the issue that 'No module named os_client_config'.

[1]:https://docs.openstack.org/os-client-config/latest/

Change-Id: I19bee5f276dcdd9a885fd99b6b656647e28ba139

commit_message:
Update custom roles doc to generate multiple roles with same properties

Roles can be generated with same role properties of an existing
role by with a different name to allow multiple roles genration
for same set of services.
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583165
Related-Bug: #1782322

Change-Id: I43eb169708ef28cc39f7ac02daeffceef53058c3

commit_message:
Use V3 auth_url

When executing 'murano environment create test' command, the result
is failed because keystone has delete V2 api. Therefore murano need
to use V3 auth_url.

Change-Id: Ia9874949c0e7bdef733815ae6d37a3f19784abe3
Co-Authored-By: zhurong <aaronzhu1121@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 21:08:27.000000000', 'message': "Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- panko_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- panko_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: Iaa11b98d3c96ec783bcdceabd21cb03dd18db4d3
"}]
commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- panko_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- panko_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: Iaa11b98d3c96ec783bcdceabd21cb03dd18db4d3

commit_message:
Move MQ vhost/user creation into role

There is no record for why we implement the MQ vhost/user creation
outside of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the
role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we implement two new variables:
- zaqar_oslomsg_rpc_setup_host
- zaqar_oslomsg_notify_setup_host

These are used in the role to allow delegation of the MQ vhost/user
setup for each type to any host, but they default to using the first
member of the applicable oslomsg host group.

We also adjust some of the defaults to automatically inherit existing
vars set in group_vars form the integrated build so that we do not
need to do the wiring in the integrated build's group vars. We still
default them in the role too for independent role usage.

Change-Id: I59780a25e86b9f213fadf2c8c64554fbe491c7b3

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I081601490f339a5dc37a6a5bc597cfc3836bd873

commit_message:
Prepare to support python3.6

This patch prepares python3.6 support.

We should add py36-local into tox.ini and support for python3.6
into setup.cfg when we decide to support python3.6 formally.

Change-Id: Ic5b4614745fbf68376e46544b630fadcc44a805a

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

To install horizon, check python3 version and set target directory
in postinstall script on package.json.

Change-Id: I2592e903b51ef5bbb3672cdc036376d3117ff197
Co-Authored-By: Shu Muto <shu.mutow@gmail.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

To install horizon, check python3 version and set target directory
in postinstall script on package.json.

Change-Id: I321a3555a4d9ae3dafbf1da39d165462933b8c44
Co-Authored-By: Shu Muto <shu.mutow@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 09:35:57.000000000', 'message': "Set start date to 'now' rather than current time

When the Blazar CLI client is run without specifying a start date, it
uses the current time on the client machine. If the lease creation
request is sent to the Blazar service just before the end of a minute,
e.g. at 12:34:59, the Blazar manager might only process it during the
next minute (i.e. after 12:35:00). In this case, the manager will reject
the request with:

    Start date must be later than current date

This can also be an issue if the clocks on the client and server are not
synchronized closely.

This patch uses the special start date value 'now' which is resolved to
the current time on the server rather than on the client. Note that this
can result in leases that are one minute less than the user might
expect.

Change-Id: Ib761d8f4f15e44e28452497f282447472f0cf918
Closes-Bug: #1783296

commit_message:
Set start date to 'now' rather than current time

When the Blazar CLI client is run without specifying a start date, it
uses the current time on the client machine. If the lease creation
request is sent to the Blazar service just before the end of a minute,
e.g. at 12:34:59, the Blazar manager might only process it during the
next minute (i.e. after 12:35:00). In this case, the manager will reject
the request with:

    Start date must be later than current date

This can also be an issue if the clocks on the client and server are not
synchronized closely.

This patch uses the special start date value 'now' which is resolved to
the current time on the server rather than on the client. Note that this
can result in leases that are one minute shorter than what the user
might expect, as the end date is still specified by the client.

It also clarifies help messages for start and end dates.

Change-Id: Ib761d8f4f15e44e28452497f282447472f0cf918
Closes-Bug: #1783296

commit_message:
NetApp: Fix to support SVM scoped permissions.

Improves NetApp cDOT block and file drivers suport for SVM scoped user
accounts. Features not supported for SVM scoped users include QoS,
aggregate usage reporting, and dedupe usage reporting.

Change-Id: I2b42622dbbb0f9f9f3eb9081cf67fb27e6c1a218
Closes-Bug: #1694579
(cherry picked from commit 887797541dff6d2cd10265de26214bcf1515fcf7)
Conflicts:
        cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/test_block_cmode.py
	cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/block_cmode.py
	cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/client_cmode.py
	cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/performance/perf_cmode.py

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 20:35:40.000000000', 'message': "Add default roles used by Barbican

The default roles used by Barbican are missing.
According to the default policy.json the roles
'key-manager:service-admin', 'creator',
'observer', 'audit' are necessary for Barbican.

This is reimplementation of the 0ed71b4 because
keystone module is used in stable/queens.

Change-Id: If50e02a5886a1f3b26eb033103904122302afeda
Closes-Bug: #1657742
"}]
commit_message:
Add default roles used by Barbican

The default roles used by Barbican are missing.
According to the default policy.json the roles
'key-manager:service-admin', 'creator',
'observer', 'audit' are necessary for Barbican.

This is reimplementation of the 0ed71b4 because
keystone module is used in stable/queens.

Change-Id: If50e02a5886a1f3b26eb033103904122302afeda
Closes-Bug: #1657742

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 15:36:21.000000000', 'message': "Correct the usage on listing neutron ports

The test case uses 'fixed_ip' as a query parameter, but the usage
is not correct. In before, the test passed because neutron
server ignored this parameter, and returned all the
ports, which happened to make the test pass.

This patch fixes the usage of this parameter. If there is no ip_address
then not to filter the list using the filter. Otherwise,
we use 'fixed_ips' parameter and populate its value correctly.

Change-Id: Iac4a6024e12ada515312ae8dd62719ae4351f508
"}]
commit_message:
Correct the usage on listing neutron ports

The test case uses 'fixed_ip' as a query parameter, but the usage
is not correct. In before, the test passed because neutron
server ignored this parameter, and returned all the
ports, which happened to make the test pass.

This patch fixes the usage of this parameter. If there is no ip_address
then not to filter the list using the filter. Otherwise,
we use 'fixed_ips' parameter and populate its value correctly.

Change-Id: Iac4a6024e12ada515312ae8dd62719ae4351f508

subject: Enable mutable config in tacker
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 22:25:07.000000000', 'message': "Enable mutable config in tacker

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
oslo.service provides an option here Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e
allows services to tell oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be
called by passing a parameter.

This commit is to use the same. This allows tacker to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. we should be able to turn debug
logging on and off by changing the config.

tc goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/enable-mutable-configuration.html

Change-Id: I81df7830bbee2288938016c214495dfe2f90eec9
"}]
commit_message:
Enable mutable config in tacker

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
oslo.service provides an option here Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e
allows services to tell oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be
called by passing a parameter.

This commit is to use the same. This allows tacker to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. we should be able to turn debug
logging on and off by changing the config.

tc goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/enable-mutable-configuration.html

Change-Id: I81df7830bbee2288938016c214495dfe2f90eec9

commit_message:
Prepare to support python3.6

This patch prepares python3.6 support.

We should add py36-local into tox.ini and support for python3.6
into setup.cfg when we decide to support python3.6 formally.

commit_message:
Fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

To install horizon, check python3 version and set target directory
in postinstall script on package.json.

Change-Id: Iadf07f630bfc5d8f8d0c2a57e108c0f05aca899d
Co-Authored-By: Shu Muto <shu.mutow@gmail.com>

commit_message:
use undercloud registry for ceph_namespace in overcloud image prepare

Currently ceph is pulled from docker.io/ceph during overcloud image
prepare. Sometimes it fails to pull the image from docker.io
registry and so it is better to use the undercloud container
registry images and use the same.

Change-Id: Ie4f9a69363fb2957300a12699c86d5126960e697
Closes-Bug: #1752874

commit_message:
Change tacker CLI to OpenStackClient CLI in docs

- tacker CLI is deprecated soon, so there is a need to change
tacker CLI to OSC CLI in the documentation.

- Update some commands related to Mistral.

Change-Id: I55932682fe0699da72b99f3b881df76f365b1f0a
Closes-Bug: #1783465

commit_message:
Replace os-client-config to openstacksdk

Since now os-client-config has been superceded by openstacksdk[1].
So need to replace the os-client-config in zaqarclient to
slove the issue that 'No module named os_client_config'.

[1]:https://docs.openstack.org/os-client-config/latest/

commit_message:
QNAP: Add support for QES 2.1.0

This patch do the following change to the QNAP Manila driver:
1. Add support for QNAP QES firmware 2.1.0.

Change-Id: I81320b6af988d19526241fd0856b427fcf1f96d7
Implements: blueprint qnap-support-qes-210

subject: Replace os-client-config to openstacksdk
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-25 05:21:09.000000000', 'message': "Replace os-client-config to openstacksdk

Since now os-client-config has been superceded by openstacksdk[1].
So need to replace the os-client-config in zaqarclient to
slove the issue that 'No module named os_client_config'.

[1]:https://docs.openstack.org/os-client-config/latest/

Change-Id: I71aad8a4cc39e56a0aa561e87d875b0aeee02733
"}]
commit_message:
Replace os-client-config to openstacksdk

Since now os-client-config has been superceded by openstacksdk[1].
So need to replace the os-client-config in zaqarclient to
slove the issue that 'No module named os_client_config'.

[1]:https://docs.openstack.org/os-client-config/latest/

Change-Id: I71aad8a4cc39e56a0aa561e87d875b0aeee02733

[{'created': '2018-05-08 22:56:23.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - vitrage driver for accepting webhook notifications

Accepts POST webhook notifications at
/v1/data-sources/<data-source-name>/tables

Expected payload format:
{
  "notification": "vitrage.alarm.activate",
  "payload": {
    "vitrage_id": "2def31e9-6d9f-4c16-b007-893caa806cd4",
    "resource": {
      "vitrage_id": "437f1f4c-ccce-40a4-ac62-1c2f1fd9f6ac",
      "name": "app-1-server-1-jz6qvznkmnif",
      "update_timestamp": "2018-01-22 10:00:34.327142+00:00",
      "vitrage_category": "RESOURCE",
      "vitrage_operational_state": "OK",
      "vitrage_type": "nova.instance",
      "project_id": "8f007e5ba0944e84baa6f2a4f2b5d03a",
      "id": "9b7d93b9-94ec-41e1-9cec-f28d4f8d702c"
    },
    "update_timestamp": "2018-01-22T10:00:34Z",
    "vitrage_category": "ALARM",
    "state": "Active",
    "vitrage_type": "vitrage",
    "vitrage_operational_severity": "WARNING",
    "name": "Instance memory performance degraded"
  }
}

https://docs.openstack.org/vitrage/latest/contributor/notifier-webhook-plugin.html

Change-Id: I1943cb81eadb1abba9e62d3d886778a09ec63118

'}, {'created': '2018-06-13 00:44:17.000000000', 'message': 'vitrage driver for accepting webhook notifications

Accepts POST webhook notifications [1] at
/v1/data-sources/<data-source-name>/webhook

On alarm activate notification from Vitrage, a new alarm row [2]
is created in Congress vitrage data source service.

On alarm deactivate notification from Vitrage, the corresponding
alarm row is deleted in Congress vitrage data source service.

A retry policy on the sender side would be helpful to avoid
notifications being lost to transient issues
(example from zaqar [3]).

Nonetheless, it is still possible that an alarm deactivate
notification is missed, and an alarm row remains in Congress
indefinitely.

To clean-up these rows, the optional config
'hours_to_keep_alarm' sets the approximate number of hours
before an active alarm row is deleted from Congress.

[1] Expected payload format:
{
  "notification": "vitrage.alarm.activate",
  "payload": {
    "vitrage_id": "2def31e9-6d9f-4c16-b007-893caa806cd4",
    "resource": {
      "vitrage_id": "437f1f4c-ccce-40a4-ac62-1c2f1fd9f6ac",
      "name": "app-1-server-1-jz6qvznkmnif",
      "update_timestamp": "2018-01-22 10:00:34.327142+00:00",
      "vitrage_category": "RESOURCE",
      "vitrage_operational_state": "OK",
      "vitrage_type": "nova.instance",
      "project_id": "8f007e5ba0944e84baa6f2a4f2b5d03a",
      "id": "9b7d93b9-94ec-41e1-9cec-f28d4f8d702c"
    },
    "update_timestamp": "2018-01-22T10:00:34Z",
    "vitrage_category": "ALARM",
    "state": "Active",
    "vitrage_type": "vitrage",
    "vitrage_operational_severity": "WARNING",
    "name": "Instance memory performance degraded"
  }
}
https://docs.openstack.org/vitrage/latest/contributor/notifier-webhook-plugin.html

[2] alarms table schema:
    'name'
    'state'
    'normalized_severity',
    'vitrage_id'
    'update_timestamp'
    'receive_timestamp'
    'resource_name'
    'resource_id'
    'resource_vitrage_id'
    'resource_project_id'
    'resource_state'
    'resource_vitrage_type'

[3] https://docs.openstack.org/zaqar/pike/user/notification_delivery_policy.html

Change-Id: I1943cb81eadb1abba9e62d3d886778a09ec63118

commit_message:
vitrage driver for accepting webhook notifications

Accepts POST webhook notifications [1] at
/v1/data-sources/<data-source-name>/webhook

On alarm activate notification from Vitrage, a new alarm row [2]
is created in Congress vitrage data source service.

On alarm deactivate notification from Vitrage, the corresponding
alarm row is deleted in Congress vitrage data source service.

A retry policy on the sender side would be helpful to avoid
notifications being lost to transient issues
(example from zaqar [3]).

Nonetheless, it is still possible that an alarm deactivate
notification is missed, and an alarm row remains in Congress
indefinitely.

To clean-up these rows, the optional config
'hours_to_keep_alarm' sets the approximate number of hours
before an active alarm row is deleted from Congress.

[1] Expected payload format:
{
  "notification": "vitrage.alarm.activate",
  "payload": {
    "vitrage_id": "2def31e9-6d9f-4c16-b007-893caa806cd4",
    "resource": {
      "vitrage_id": "437f1f4c-ccce-40a4-ac62-1c2f1fd9f6ac",
      "name": "app-1-server-1-jz6qvznkmnif",
      "update_timestamp": "2018-01-22 10:00:34.327142+00:00",
      "vitrage_category": "RESOURCE",
      "vitrage_operational_state": "OK",
      "vitrage_type": "nova.instance",
      "project_id": "8f007e5ba0944e84baa6f2a4f2b5d03a",
      "id": "9b7d93b9-94ec-41e1-9cec-f28d4f8d702c"
    },
    "update_timestamp": "2018-01-22T10:00:34Z",
    "vitrage_category": "ALARM",
    "state": "Active",
    "vitrage_type": "vitrage",
    "vitrage_operational_severity": "WARNING",
    "name": "Instance memory performance degraded"
  }
}
https://docs.openstack.org/vitrage/latest/contributor/notifier-webhook-plugin.html

[2] alarms table schema:
    'name'
    'state'
    'type'
    'operational_severity',
    'vitrage_id'
    'update_timestamp'
    'receive_timestamp'
    'resource_name'
    'resource_id'
    'resource_vitrage_id'
    'resource_project_id'
    'resource_operational_state'
    'resource_type'

[3] https://docs.openstack.org/zaqar/pike/user/notification_delivery_policy.html

Change-Id: I1943cb81eadb1abba9e62d3d886778a09ec63118

in python3, the autobahn lib's input and output is bytes instead
of string.

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 08:40:35.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I18221cade60034e03f3f5358be37ce6ef18367fe
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I18221cade60034e03f3f5358be37ce6ef18367fe

subject: Pin get-pip.py to 3.2
messages:
[{'account_id': 28427, 'date': '2018-07-18 09:01:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-07-25 04:38:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Note sure this applies to this patch but https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585503/ seems to be addressing some of the issues raised by latest get-pip
Furthermore, I discovered your work after submitting my own (https://review.openstack.org/585337) which I abandoned due to the aforementioned patchset
Wouldn't it be nicer to use variables instead of hardcoded values ? Just asking as I discovered that using variables was not so straightforward due to the deep interdependencies of ironic* projects"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-18 09:01:36.000000000', 'message': "Pin get-pip.py to 3.2

As get-pip.py evolves based on pip 10, while we're still using
pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to
pip 7.1.2 which fulfills our needs.

Change-Id: I2d03e03d9725fd980a6aa49ee64b5d08d799e5c0
"}]
commit_message:
Pin get-pip.py to 3.2

As get-pip.py evolves based on pip 10, while we're still using
pip 9, changes in the way it can be used are causing problems.

For example, the ability to use --download is no longer there.

As such, let's pin to a known good version and leave it at that
until we no longer need to use this script. Version 3.2 maps to
pip 7.1.2 which fulfills our needs.

Change-Id: I2d03e03d9725fd980a6aa49ee64b5d08d799e5c0

commit_message:
Add configurable value for get-pip.py retrieval

Like it is done in devstack, making this configurable
allows to somehow pinpoint the version used by
some components. In case get-pip.py is broken (like it
seems to be now) one can specify a proper backward compatible
version.

Change-Id: I19ac1b345f95cd1296a043a34ea988b0fdd306e7

[{'created': '2018-07-22 22:45:10.000000000', 'message': 'Temporarily disable flow diagraming

The networkx package changed their dependecy model in version 2.1 and
now uses "pydot" and adds the dependency via setuptools "extras".
Unfortunately they only define an "extra" of "all" which installs packages
we do not need and fail to install.

So until the "extras" are fixed in networkx, we need to disable flow
diagraming.

Change-Id: I4f9082c267dc7da14b81cb551eeb10bbf58c175a
See: https://github.com/networkx/networkx/pull/3080
'}]
commit_message:
Temporarily disable flow diagraming

The networkx package changed their dependecy model in version 2.1 and
now uses "pydot" and adds the dependency via setuptools "extras".
Unfortunately they only define an "extra" of "all" which installs packages
we do not need and fail to install.

So until the "extras" are fixed in networkx, we need to disable flow
diagraming.

Change-Id: I4f9082c267dc7da14b81cb551eeb10bbf58c175a
See: https://github.com/networkx/networkx/pull/3080

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to transition plan [1],
we should have py36 testenv ready for it.

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition

Change-Id: I1f49f809eaab24de124190acd0a25e2fe44497cd

but was missed in "image list".

Story: 2001925

commit_message:
Remove notification_driver parameter from heat profile

The service profile has a default that overrides the one set either
by 'NotificationDriver' parameter or 'heat::notification_driver' in
ExtraConfig.

This parameter is not there in any other service profile and can
be removed as it's not used by the service.

Change-Id: I1570f59be977773ba8a0ff1222b57f88a9954ca8
Closes-Bug: #1782720

commit_message:
Add keymaster to fetch root secret from KMIP service

Add a new middleware that can be used to fetch an encryption root
secret from a KMIP service. The middleware uses a PyKMIP client
to interact with a KMIP endpoint. The middleware is configured with
a unique identifier for the key to be fetched and options required
for the PyKMIP client.

Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ib0943fb934b347060fc66c091673a33bcfac0a6d

commit_message:
Expose node.conductor_group in the REST API

This adds microversion 1.46 to allow:

* returning conductor_group in the node object
* specifying conductor_group in the node create API
* specifying conductor_group in the node update API
* allow filtering nodes by conductor_group

Change-Id: I32e0333c78cfcb2d88dfd4f70f0be012dcfef407
Story: 2001795
Task: 22643

subject: Remove unecessary back-slashes in CephManilaClientKey caps mon
messages:
[{'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-06-16 14:54:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-06-18 09:09:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

John, I think we have to test this manually because scenario004 is not exercising Manila?

If you can confirm it working, I'd be happy to clean this stuff :D"}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-06-18 09:13:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-06-18 13:22:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> John, I think we have to test this manually because scenario004 is
 > not exercising Manila?
 > 
 > If you can confirm it working, I'd be happy to clean this stuff :D

I haven't tested how Manila works with this yet. I've just seen that the the patch produces the cleaner looking key. 

Tom, when you get a chance (no rush) do you want to try this? I am assuming Manila still works with the backslashes or we would have bigger issues, but if they are affecting Manila then we would need to move more quickly. Thanks."}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-06-18 13:31:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Manila works with the current code; I will test with the cleanup and report back, looks like it *should* work.  We can see that that key is generated cleanly in scenario004 below but as Giulio noted it isn't currently actually used."}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-06-19 10:18:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For the moment I tested this change with downstream OSP13 (since that's what my machine is running for other reasons).  It works but the key isn't the simple readable key that I would have expected:

[root@controller-0 ~]# cat /etc/ceph/ceph.client.manila.keyring 
[client.manila]
	key = AQCKVShbAAAAABAAzhBFf2MOTv0I8zkOxkAThg==
	caps mds = "'allow *'"
	caps mgr = "'allow *'"
	caps mon = "'allow r, allow command '"'"'auth del'"'"', allow command '"'"'auth caps'"'"', allow command '"'"'auth get'"'"', allow command '"'"'auth get-or-create'"'"''"
	caps osd = "'allow rw'"

This is with ceph-ansible.noarch 3.1.0-0.1.rc9.el7cp'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-07-06 15:41:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So Tom go this...

	caps mon = "'allow r, allow command '"'"'auth del'"'"', allow command '"'"'auth caps'"'"', allow command '"'"'auth get'"'"', allow command '"'"'auth get-or-create'"'"''"

Which is worse than what the original bug reported of:

caps mon = "allow r, allow command \"auth del\", allow command \"auth caps\", allow command \"auth get\", allow command \"auth get-or-create\""

I would have hoped the following instead from this patch:

"allow r, allow command 'auth del', allow command 'auth caps', allow command 'auth get', allow command 'auth get-or-create'"

I guess I'll have to figure out why.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-07-06 16:12:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Actually, we can't test this change against queens and it won't be backported to queens. This is because the THT for master [1] uses a different syntax so that it can use ceph-ansible's new keys module. The THT for queens [2] uses the older syntax by design for backward compatibility reasons.  


[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/docker/services/ceph-ansible/ceph-base.yaml#L283-L285

[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/queens/docker/services/ceph-ansible/ceph-base.yaml#L302"}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2018-07-06 16:17:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

To review, the output of scenario004 from CI [1] produces a clean looking key [2] but we still need to test it with Manila deployed by the master branch.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/15/575915/1/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario004-multinode-oooq-container/7715778/logs/subnode-2/etc/ceph/

[2]
"""
[client.manila]
	key = AQDqMyVbAAAAABAA0VIE9i29ZcbHNrURWvyYXQ==
	caps mds = "allow *"
	caps mgr = "allow *"
	caps mon = "allow r, allow command 'auth del', allow command 'auth caps', allow command 'auth get', allow command 'auth get-or-create'"
	caps osd = "allow rw"
"""'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-07-06 17:35:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@John - ack, and the only reason I tested against queens is that my servers are tied up on osp13 (or osp10) fighting downstream issues.  Hope to get back to developing on master again someday soon.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-07-16 16:20:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

sounds like this is fine for merging in >= rocky ?'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-07-24 18:32:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Remove unecessary back-slashes in CephManilaClientKey caps mon

Within the double-quoted capability string replace back-slashed
double quotes with single quotes.

Change-Id: Iff6e8f52c28a2de826e1582775727df85384b696
Closes-Bug: #1777249

[{'created': '2018-07-04 02:34:19.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I479a4e5d5a8bd40f8fd36f621aa9fdb5b74fe336
'}, {'created': '2018-07-05 07:21:32.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I479a4e5d5a8bd40f8fd36f621aa9fdb5b74fe336
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I479a4e5d5a8bd40f8fd36f621aa9fdb5b74fe336

subject: Clean imports in code
messages:
[{'account_id': 19853, 'date': '2018-02-21 08:35:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13940, 'date': '2018-02-21 17:17:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

I think you didn't read your commit message. Please read it again then abandon this patch.

You're trying to import Object not Module!
Guidelines; You should import modules not OBJECTS!"}, {'account_id': 19853, 'date': '2018-02-22 01:48:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Saad Zaher, could you please clarify what you mean? I do change from import Object to import Module.

Here is the guide:
https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/#imports'}, {'account_id': 19853, 'date': '2018-07-25 03:12:50.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 08:35:39.000000000', 'message': 'Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: I6123b4a1b2d80172a550a71aaf123621e7e454ee
'}]
commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects. In the Openstack style guidelines
they recommend to import only modules. [1]: "Do not import objects, only modules".

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/hacking/0.10.3/

Change-Id: I6123b4a1b2d80172a550a71aaf123621e7e454ee

I believe there is a hacking check for this purpose. Maybe we should enable it and fix all occurrences of the issue.

I'm not too found of just fixing this one and risk merging the same kind of error in future patches."}, {'account_id': 8158, 'date': '2016-08-24 14:14:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I believe there is a hacking check for this purpose. Maybe we
 > should enable it and fix all occurrences of the issue.
 > 
 > I'm not too found of just fixing this one and risk merging the same
 > kind of error in future patches.

Cyril,
You make a good point about enabling a hacking check and fixing all occurrences. I'm all in for it. But, this change in itself doesn't risk anything. With or without this change the chance of a future change merging with incorrect imports is the same. So, I don't see a problem merging this change. 

Let me know what you think."}, {'account_id': 6968, 'date': '2016-09-07 06:46:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Stumbled upon this because there is a similar change for Swift.

@Cyril: unfortunately the hacking check has been removed: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/142586/1/HACKING.rst,cm

So the guideline still recommends to import modules, but without checking it. I'm biased on this..."}, {'account_id': 22448, 'date': '2016-09-12 21:15:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22448, 'date': '2017-04-07 20:34:31.000000000', 'content': 'Removed the following votes:

* Code-Review+1 by Alexander Bashmakov <alexander.bashmakov@intel.com>
'}, {'account_id': 19853, 'date': '2018-07-25 03:12:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

In the Openstack style guidelines they recommend to import only modules.

Change-Id: I0c87db7e9602de767c734b71704e5d4339c1b79c

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

In some part in the code we import objects.
In the Openstack style guidelines they recommend to import only modules.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

Change-Id: I0c87db7e9602de767c734b71704e5d4339c1b79c

commit_message:
server-get/update show wrong values about 'id' and 'update_at'

While process 'designate server-get' and 'designate server-update',
the 'id' and 'update_at' values are wrong, they should be
interchanged.

Change-Id: Ibddf9cc9a018774ed229c0dfa81e705cd74704bc
Closes-Bug: #1777576
