(16 comments)

Thanks Jim, looks good but there are a few things missing I think. I didn't look at the unit tests yet, and I still want to think a bit more about rolling upgrades..."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-07-12 16:18:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)

wrt rolling upgrades. This should work, EXCEPT in the small window (hopefully small), where all the conductors are running this new code, and the RPC version is unpinned. To refresh my (and your memory), see [1]. At step 3, it is unpinned and the conductors need to be restarted (SIGHUP'd). During the start/end interval of these restarts, there will be some conductors that are still pinned and not using groups, and other conductors that are using groups.

ARGH. Does a SIGHUP cause the hash_ring to be reset/regenerated? Jim, did you try this, or were you restarting the conductor after unpinning?

Hmm, I just thought of something else. We need the hash ring to be in sync between conductors AND API nodes. So the interval is from the start of unpinning until *all* API & conductor nodes are reset...

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/ironic/latest/contributor/rolling-upgrades.html#rolling-upgrade-process"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-07-12 16:55:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

(3 comments)

wrt the rolling upgrades and the time interval where the hash_ring won't be in sync  between the conductors and APIs, that might be acceptable. There is going to be a bunch of thrashing anyway, when restarting them, and we already have a mechanism to reset the hash rings based on the hash_ring_reset_interval.

Also, I am willing to revisit the key used for the hash_ring. I think you originally wanted it to be $conductor_group$drivername. Now that we don't support classic drivers, it might be ok to use the above; which makes it the same as the current keys, with $conductor_group=''. Then there is no issue with upgrading to this. (Someone else needs to think about whether this makes sense; I've run out of brain cells for this feature.)"}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-07-13 15:59:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(16 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-07-13 17:46:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)

So my concern with rolling upgrades, and delimited key or non-delimited key in hash_ring, was incorrect. I was thinking that the value was different, based on the key. That isn't true, since the value represents the set of conductors (of the same conductor_group) that support the same driver/hw type. For this new feature, the conductor_group is '', so the value for the hash ring will be the same, keyed with or without a delimiter. Since the hashring is local, the API or conductor process knows whether to use delimited (new code) or undelimited (old code) to get the info, so all is good.

Geez, I hope this makes sense now :)

Sorry for that confusion; I should have spent a bit more time refreshing my memory of what we did with the hash_ring stuff."}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-07-20 20:22:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 10343, 'date': '2018-07-20 20:24:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Thanks Jim! For fear of blocking you again :), here are some comments. I was thinking that we may not need the rpc API version change, since there isn't actually any coordination needed between api & conductor. Since they have their own local copies of the hash rings.

Then I was thinking that we may be able to get rid of all the 'use_groups' stuff in the hash_ring code (still need it in the db part).

But I don't want to cause any more trouble now, so these are just my thoughts. The only thing is confirmation about whether the class' cached hash_ring could be used by more than one API request at the same time."}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2018-07-20 23:05:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

This changes the calculation for keys in the hash ring manager to be of
the form "<conductor_group>:<driver>", instead of just driver. This is
used when the RPC version pin is 1.45 or greater (1.45 was created to

as part of this calculation. However, this becomes a problem when we
don't have a node that we're looking up a topic for. This is currently
implemented as using no group, and left as a TODO to decide how to do it
better.

commit_message:
Use conductor group for hash ring calculations

This changes the calculation for keys in the hash ring manager to be of
the form "<conductor_group>:<driver>", instead of just driver. This is
used when the RPC version pin is 1.47 or greater (1.47 was created to
handle this).

When finding an RPC topic, we use the conductor group marked on the node
as part of this calculation. However, this becomes a problem when we
don't have a node that we're looking up a topic for. In this case we
look for a conductor in any group which has the driver loaded, and use a
temporary hash ring that does not use conductor groups to find a
conductor.

This also begins the API work, as the API must be aware of the new hash
ring calculation. However, exposing the conductor_group field and adding
a microversion is left for a future patch.

Story: 2001795
Task: 22641
Change-Id: Iaf71348666b683518fc6ce4769112459d98938f2

correct typo yaml.dumps

unlike in json package, it's simply yaml.dump
also moved import of yaml to thirdparty package section

commit_message:
Implement the "check_exc" parameter for OVO

This patch set is to implement "check_exc" parameter. It will
be used during converting model to OVO.

Moreover, this patch will create some usefull functions.

Partial Implements: blueprint rolling-upgrade

Change-Id: Ie4a0a47e14346ba81c15c80928a485e55c2c83ee

This patch set will implement the MockObjectMixin. This class
with be used when developers want to mock Barbican OVO class.

commit_message:
Remove unused policy enforcer attributes

We were keeping track of the attributes from the policy enforcer that
come from files and copying those attributes to a cache. This was not
being used and only introduced performance overhead. So it's being
removed.

Change-Id: I3acaf8b4d0bb69d116d22ee48fcddec8292d9844

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 15:09:29.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifc0557996260608bbbb9437fe527e0fef5f05415
'}, {'created': '2018-07-23 03:53:55.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifc0557996260608bbbb9437fe527e0fef5f05415
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ifc0557996260608bbbb9437fe527e0fef5f05415

commit_message:
Removing deprecated functions xrange and cmp

The functions xrange() and cmp() are not supported in python3.
This commit removes usage of these two.
Reference - https://docs.python.org/3.0/whatsnew/3.0.html

Change-Id: I26fd0d6a06cd2ddb32da17c4d6d7329d773f7828

commit_message:

The django form field default is "required=True", so this patch
remove the redundant "required=True" in the form.

Change-Id: I570c8ec25f9434c9b8c84d3c5ed6ffd1789cd1a2

Thanks for the suggestion, Kristi. I'll add it once the db schema is done, otherwise this patch can not pass the CI due to the FK problem."}, {'account_id': 15699, 'date': '2018-06-20 03:11:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-06-20 13:47:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

This looks good. I wouldn't mind a release note though, even if this API is experimental. 

On that note, the unified-limits bp isn't really being tracked against Rocky at all any more (we're only tracking the strict two level work or improvements to the API for that work).

That said, I wouldn't be opposed to opening a bug for this as it seems like a reasonable RFE.

Otherwise, this patch looks rock solid."}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-06-26 17:03:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-06-27 03:01:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Delete project limits when deleting project

When deleting a project, the limits belong to the project should
be deleted as well.

Change-Id: I5f7eed9bf4f69cb7d79e44acac27c6c5881be22e
Closes-Bug: #1779903

commit_message:
Set nullPointMode for Time to Ready panel

Experiment with setting nullPointMode to connected, to restore
previous look for panel. Upgrading to newer grafana seems to have
removed this setting.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-16 12:49:46.000000000', 'message': 'Cap additional nova-network tests at Queens

As noted in I7aea99d7c1818b8edcda41ba4eaa062a8ea069eb, nova is working
on removing the nova-network only compute REST APIs in the Rocky
release, which means any requests to those APIs after Queens will result
in a 410 response, regardless of microversion or whether or not neutron
is being used.

The os-floating-ips-bulk API is being removed in nova change
I89d081108b398d8efba9636279088c61349b21e6. As a result,
os-floating-ips-bulk tests will no longer works against Rocky+ versions
of nova. Skip this test using the check added in the previous change.

Related to blueprint remove-nova-network

Change-Id: I8c60310cd5d1795b4493ab4c113d614d2208f615
'}]
commit_message:
Cap additional nova-network tests at Queens

As noted in I7aea99d7c1818b8edcda41ba4eaa062a8ea069eb, nova is working
on removing the nova-network only compute REST APIs in the Rocky
release, which means any requests to those APIs after Queens will result
in a 410 response, regardless of microversion or whether or not neutron
is being used.

The os-floating-ips-bulk API is being removed in nova change
I89d081108b398d8efba9636279088c61349b21e6. As a result,
os-floating-ips-bulk tests will no longer works against Rocky+ versions
of nova. Skip this test using the check added in the previous change.

Related to blueprint remove-nova-network

Change-Id: I8c60310cd5d1795b4493ab4c113d614d2208f615

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 14:44:52.000000000', 'message': "DnsServers using get_attr

Nameservers are configured on the ctlplane subnets by the
undercloud installer, the nameservers are used early during
the deployment, prior to running os-net-config.

Remove the default DnsServer's in THT, replacing it with
an empty list and use get_attr to get the values for
DnsServers for the overcloud from the ctlplane subnet(s).

A conditinal is used in  puppet/role.role.j2.yaml so that
the parameter value is used whenever it is not [] (default)
to provide backwards compatibilityi and in case the user
want to use different DnsServers for the overcloud and
undercloud.

Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: I5f33e06ca3f4b13cc355e02156edd9d8a1f773cd
"}, {'created': '2018-07-02 20:32:16.000000000', 'message': "DnsServers using get_attr

commit_message:
DnsServers using get_attr

Nameservers are configured on the ctlplane subnets by the
undercloud installer, the nameservers are used early during
the deployment, prior to running os-net-config.

Remove the default DnsServer's in THT, replacing it with
an empty list and use get_attr to get the values for
DnsServers for the overcloud from the ctlplane subnet(s).

A conditinal is used in  puppet/role.role.j2.yaml so that
the parameter value is used whenever it is not [] (default)
to provide backwards compatibilityi and in case the user
want to use different DnsServers for the overcloud and
undercloud.

Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: I5f33e06ca3f4b13cc355e02156edd9d8a1f773cd

commit_message:
Add project hierarchical tree check when Keystone start

Add a check function for project hierarchical tree check
when starting Keystone. If the tree depth exceed the
enforcement model's depth, fail to start keystone process

Change-Id: I4ce6a48505b8b9688bbdd18ee46ce035ee0938ed
bp: strict-two-level-model

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 12:34:28.000000000', 'message': "compute: host: expand kwargs in host_set() call

`host_set()` expects `status` and `maintenance_mode` as keyword
arguments, but in `SetHost.take_action()`, it is called without
expanding the keyword arguments.

So it's called as

```
host_set(host, {'status': 'enable'})
```

instead of

```
host_set(host, status='enable')
```

Change-Id: If0b37ac60091161a892bfc694fce31a988f66005
Task: 23023

commit_message:
compute: host: expand kwargs in host_set() call

`host_set()` expects `status` and `maintenance_mode` as keyword
arguments, but in `SetHost.take_action()`, it is called without
expanding the keyword arguments.

So it's called as

```
host_set(host, {'status': 'enable'})
```

instead of

```
host_set(host, status='enable')
```

Change-Id: If0b37ac60091161a892bfc694fce31a988f66005
Task: 23023

[{'created': '2018-07-24 21:14:43.000000000', 'message': "Add unified setup and beat config

The beats were all enabled with the default settings to enable
dashboards and templating when the specific beat starts. In a large
scale environment this creates a DDOS against Kibana as all beats begin
uploading templates and dashboards clobbering one another. This change
moves the dashboard config into a common template and sets everything
using sane defaults so that we're not inadvertently killing our clusters
when rolling restarts happen, like in the event of an upgrade.

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add unified setup and beat config

The beats were all enabled with the default settings to enable
dashboards and templating when the specific beat starts. In a large
scale environment this creates a DDOS against Kibana as all beats begin
uploading templates and dashboards clobbering one another. This change
moves the dashboard config into a common template and sets everything
using sane defaults so that we're not inadvertently killing our clusters
when rolling restarts happen, like in the event of an upgrade.

Change-Id: Ib48ea34a350335b72c3e3df941853c405072446a
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Retry resource creation on conflict

If resource creation fails with an HTTP Conflict error, this is presumably
due to a race condition with one of the underlying services. In this case,
allow Heat to retry the resource creation so that hopefully in most cases
the user will never have to deal with the error.

Change-Id: I301bb28231fcdc249f86ec1a2f09cb993023785b
Story: #1745010
Task: 17344

commit_message:
Add multi-store support

Added multi-store support. User can now use '--backend'
option to pass desired store while creating, uploading or
importing image to speific store backend.

Added new command 'stores-info' which will return available
stores information to the user.

Related to blueprint multi-store
Change-Id: I7370094fc4ed47205b5a86a18b22aaa7b9457e5b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-02 14:44:52.000000000', 'message': "EC2MetadatIp using get_attr

The route to metadata service is set up in host_routes
of ctlplane subnets by extraconf post deploy::
  extraconfig/post_deploy/undercloud_ctlplane_network.py

Use get_attr on the server resource to resolve attribute
value from the subnet(s) and pass it to the parameter
'EC2MetadatIp' used in the THT/network/config/* templates.

Changes the default for 'EC2MetadatIp' to ''.
Removes the comment that the value should be overriden in
parameters_defaults. It also removes the parameter from
network-environment templates.

A conditinal is used in  puppet/role.role.j2.yaml so that
the parameter value is used whenever it is not '' (the
default) to provide backwards compatibility in case the
user set a different value for this parameter in
network-environment.yaml.

When deploying a routed control plane the network config
templates would previously need to be updated to carry
'EC2MetadatIpLeafX' parameters for each leaf.  By getting
the value to pass from the server resource this change
reduces the required nic-config template customisation.
(Reduces the risk of user error.)

Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: I9c019ec840a44ca8c5f98be55daea365bc6554ec
"}, {'created': '2018-07-02 20:32:16.000000000', 'message': "EC2MetadatIp using get_attr

commit_message:
EC2MetadatIp using get_attr

The route to metadata service is set up in host_routes
of ctlplane subnets by extraconf post deploy::
  extraconfig/post_deploy/undercloud_ctlplane_network.py

Use get_attr on the server resource to resolve attribute
value from the subnet(s) and pass it to the parameter
'EC2MetadatIp' used in the THT/network/config/* templates.

Changes the default for 'EC2MetadatIp' to ''.
Removes the comment that the value should be overriden in
parameters_defaults. It also removes the parameter from
network-environment templates.

A conditinal is used in  puppet/role.role.j2.yaml so that
the parameter value is used whenever it is not '' (the
default) to provide backwards compatibility in case the
user set a different value for this parameter in
network-environment.yaml.

When deploying a routed control plane the network config
templates would previously need to be updated to carry
'EC2MetadatIpLeafX' parameters for each leaf.  By getting
the value to pass from the server resource this change
reduces the required nic-config template customisation.
(Reduces the risk of user error.)

Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Change-Id: I9c019ec840a44ca8c5f98be55daea365bc6554ec

[{'created': '2018-07-24 18:55:24.000000000', 'message': "Remove unnecessary calls to parse_header_string().

Since we define the getheader() method on the response from

will already be converted properly.

Change-Id: Ia81e8674b828b3ff1f014454126b469e41adfc23
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary calls to parse_header_string().

Since we define the getheader() method on the response from
HTTPConnection, we don't have to call parse_header_string, as the values
will already be converted properly.

Change-Id: Ia81e8674b828b3ff1f014454126b469e41adfc23

commit_message:
Update microversion for force delete volume parameter

Force delete is introduced since 3.23, correct the mv
used in API controller.

NOTE: the patch has been updated manually to avoid
testcase failure.

 > '--force' parameter to delete VNFs in special states.

Hi Phouc,

Yes, Agree on this. We needs a force_delete mechanism for such cases. I will register a BP for the same.

In the existing implementation, when a VNF stuck in pending_delete state, vnfm raise not found error.

[{'created': '2018-07-24 12:10:21.000000000', 'message': "cont/uc: remove --use-heat

This parameter is deprecated in Rocky and the default is now a
containerized undercloud so we don't need it when upgrading, it'll by
default upgrade to a containerized undercloud.

commit_message:
cont/uc: remove --use-heat

This parameter is deprecated in Rocky and the default is now a
containerized undercloud so we don't need it when upgrading, it'll by
default upgrade to a containerized undercloud.
Note, we keep the -y here which is new in Rocky and is required so the
upgrade starts right away.

Change-Id: If1b094dbef2af16b6cd21bae3ce99ffe41c3ffa0

commit_message:
Revert "Run propose-update-constraints under Python3.6"

This reverts commit c1de884d33cb4fc252e71c5477b87ac5c9ba653b.

propose-updates-constraints != propose-updates.  The later does what I want, the former is used by the release-team after releasing a new library.

#eggonface

Change-Id: I75280b23e2e60800af45dc2343c82008ec9971a9

commit_message:
Back out some version bumps

I'm giving up on trying to back out all of the test-requirements
up-revs, but let's try to stay compatibile with old requests/six.

As part of that, only disable some requests warnings on new-enough requests.

Note that we should now be compatible with distro packages back to
Ubuntu 16.04 and CentOS 6. Our six is still too new for Trusty, but
hey, there's less than a year left on that anyway, right?

Change-Id: Iccb23638393616f9ec3da660dd5e39ea4ea94220
Related-Change: I2a8f465c8b08370517cbec857933b08fca94ca38

[{'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-01-18 07:38:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-01-18 08:46:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-01-18 09:11:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-18 12:33:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

This could be a good approach. I know some storage like VMAX only works in 8G increments, so this may help them (though I think right now they just lie to Cinder).

My only concern on size*2 was whether we would run out of limited gate image space, but I think we are or about to increase that size to accommodate some other tests. And tempest-full has passed, so the LVM driver with the available space must be OK with this change.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2018-01-19 14:29:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

interesting that we haven't hit this before elsewhere. let's see what the tempest devs say :)"}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-01-19 22:31:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

> This could be a good approach. I know some storage like VMAX only

 > My only concern on size*2 was whether we would run out of limited

Sounds reasonable. and as to "only works in 8G increments", I am curious about whether the volume must be created with at least 8G size too?'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2018-01-25 01:44:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

TommyLike

Thanks for your explanation.
Could you clarify the "hardware limit" and "operation strategies" on the commit message?

commit_message:
Replace volume size with configured value

Use configured value as volume size unit when
create and extend volume.

NOTE: Some backends don't support the case of "size+1"
(VMAX only works in 8G increments) and the cloud providers
may have their own operation strategies to decide the
allowed input for volume size, such as minimum, maximum,
size unit,  etc.

Change-Id: I2c0e662229aba2281733d092f6b1ca6acea237ee

[{'created': '2018-06-28 05:10:05.000000000', 'message': 'Call kpartx remove in umount, not cleanup

The order of things called is "dib-block-device umount" *then*
"dib-block-device cleanup".

Because we're doing the "kpartx -d" here in cleanup, it means that the
loop-device is removed in umount phase from level0/localloop.py, then
afterwards we try and remove the partitions.

Change-Id: I7af3c5cf66afd81a481f454b5207af552ad52a32

commit_message:
Call kpartx remove in umount, not cleanup

Similar to I697bfbf042816c5ddf170bde9534cc4f0c7279ff, the order of
things called is "dib-block-device umount" *then* "dib-block-device
cleanup".

Because we're doing the "kpartx -d" here in cleanup, it means that the
loop-device is removed in umount phase from level0/localloop.py, then
afterwards we try and remove the partitions.

Change-Id: I7af3c5cf66afd81a481f454b5207af552ad52a32
TODO: a test case to ensure the ordering

[{'created': '2018-06-28 00:58:13.000000000', 'message': 'Move localloop to exec_sudo

One call in localloop requires the output of the command, so modify
exec_sudo to buffer up output and return it.  This is modelled on the
same thing in package-installs-v2 which seems to work.  Rather than
return a subprocess exception, return a dib exception which everything
should have imported anyway.

The overall reason for this is to make our external calls more
consistent for mocking in unit testing.

commit_message:
Move localloop to exec_sudo

One call in localloop requires the output of the command, so modify
exec_sudo to buffer up output and return it.  This is modelled on the
same thing in package-installs-v2 which seems to work.  Rather than
return a subprocess exception, return a dib exception which everything
should have imported anyway.

The overall reason for this is to make our external calls more
consistent for mocking in unit testing.

Change-Id: I10d23b873dee9f775daef2a4c8be5671d02c386e

commit_message:
Skip access metadata tests at unsupported versions

Recently share access metadata tests were added for
microversion 2.45 without the skips needed when they
are run on stable branches, where there is no support
for that microversion.

Add the needed skips.

Closes-Bug: #1783334

Change-Id: I26225a591d837350744bfc6ac04624456ee98a21

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 00:10:05.000000000', 'message': "Run propose-update-constraints under Python3.6

Currently we're running propose-update-constraints under python 3.5 (on
xenial).  We take the results of freezing the constraints fro 3.5 and
emit them as 3.4 constraints also.  In the near term[1] we'd like to use
the same technique to generate 3.6 constraints also.

With the inclusion of I8784509bc162eb6f2e80261bc2d81dbe63ce7989, and
knowing that we no longer run on trusty node, we can now clone the 3.5
constraints freeze to both 3.4 and 3.6.  However given that soon we'll
be moving from xenial to bionic this introduces debt that will need to
be fixed after the August release.

Instead just move propose-update-constraints job to bionic now and start
cloning 3.6 to 3.5 and 3.4.

[1] See re-design discussion:
    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/132152.html

Change-Id: I541b64afaee3bf466ff1a461fd2cb472657c4986
"}]
commit_message:
Run propose-update-constraints under Python3.6

Currently we're running propose-update-constraints under python 3.5 (on
xenial).  We take the results of freezing the constraints fro 3.5 and
emit them as 3.4 constraints also.  In the near term[1] we'd like to use
the same technique to generate 3.6 constraints also.

With the inclusion of I8784509bc162eb6f2e80261bc2d81dbe63ce7989, and
knowing that we no longer run on trusty node, we can now clone the 3.5
constraints freeze to both 3.4 and 3.6.  However given that soon we'll
be moving from xenial to bionic this introduces debt that will need to
be fixed after the August release.

Instead just move propose-update-constraints job to bionic now and start
cloning 3.6 to 3.5 and 3.4.

[1] See re-design discussion:
    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/132152.html

Change-Id: I541b64afaee3bf466ff1a461fd2cb472657c4986

subject: Use run_once instead of a group that does not exist
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-24 17:44:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7414, 'date': '2018-07-24 17:50:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nWorks in my testing'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-24 18:19:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-24 21:00:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 17:44:59.000000000', 'message': "Use run_once instead of a group that does not exist

The var keystone_services['keystone-api']['group'] is not defined.
While I have no idea why the task wasn't failing outright due to
that, it was having some rather unwanted side-effects - like running
on all keystone containers.

Given that keystone only has one group, we can just use run_once
instead.

Change-Id: Iad494d503bb04741b3b0ea461d8a9ce1988b24c7
"}]
commit_message:
Use run_once instead of a group that does not exist

The var keystone_services['keystone-api']['group'] is not defined.
While I have no idea why the task wasn't failing outright due to
that, it was having some rather unwanted side-effects - like running
on all keystone containers.

Given that keystone only has one group, we can just use run_once
instead.

Change-Id: Iad494d503bb04741b3b0ea461d8a9ce1988b24c7

commit_message:
Add support to customize polling meters

This adds a new parameter called polling_meters
to the ceilometer::agent::polling class.

If you pass a array of strings this parameter
will then populate the meters in the polling.yaml
file by inserting them in the templated polling file.

The default values that was hardcoded in the template
is still the same but has been moved to the params class
as an array of strings.

Change-Id: Iae2567b5a0f24b2aa80f9640ff10df96cd656922

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 21:10:04.000000000', 'message': "Correct the usage on listing neutron ports

The test case uses 'fixed_ip' as a query parameter, but the usage
is not correct. In before, the test passed because neutron
server ignored this parameter, and returned all the
ports, which happened to make the test pass.

This patch fixes the usage of this parameter. If there is no ip_address
then not to filter the list using the filter. Otherwise,
we use 'fixed_ips' parameter and populate its value correctly.

Change-Id: If46d6a739ce6799d2bf13146cdb748af8759c932
"}]
commit_message:
Correct the usage on listing neutron ports

The test case uses 'fixed_ip' as a query parameter, but the usage
is not correct. In before, the test passed because neutron
server ignored this parameter, and returned all the
ports, which happened to make the test pass.

This patch fixes the usage of this parameter. If there is no ip_address
then not to filter the list using the filter. Otherwise,
we use 'fixed_ips' parameter and populate its value correctly.

Change-Id: If46d6a739ce6799d2bf13146cdb748af8759c932

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-19275 : FAILURE in 1h 43m 03s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-02 16:48:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

In running some tests before and after this change I'm not seeing a noticeable difference in the time it takes, in aggregate, to get the instances for each host. I'm using the fake virt driver in a single-node devstack setup with 20 fake compute hosts and each host has 10 instances loaded up on it, for a total of 200 instances in the system.

My timer patch might have a bug in it (I need to check), or maybe the scale isn't large enough to make a noticeable difference yet (I could try to get to 50 compute hosts but I run out of memory on the devstack VM, or I could try to run 50 instances per host to get to 1000 instances total).

It would be nice if a large deployment, like CERN, could test this out in a test environment to see if it helps them during scheduling."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-06-06 17:59:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-06 19:59:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

(2 comments)

LGTM.  Going to let Dan push it.'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-06-07 11:15:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-06-07 18:57:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Workflow-1

I'm waiting to hear from CERN is this helps them with scheduling at all at scale, or for me to get a chance to test some more in devstack with more than 20 fake computes (although I started running out of ram in that case) or more instances on those 20 computes."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2018-07-23 16:17:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

makes sense to me given the limited usage of the function today.

do we have have any perfomance data to indicate what effect this will have from cern.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-23 16:36:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> do we have have any perfomance data to indicate what effect this will have from cern.

No, hence my -W on the change until we actually got reports from a large deployment that verified that this helps in a significant way at scale. My scale tests using fake compute nodes and the fake virt driver in devstack didn't pan out as I'd hoped."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-24 15:02:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Sounds like this does make a noticeable difference at large scale:

(9:58:01 AM) s10: mriedem: about https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bug/1737465+(status:open+OR+status:merged).
(9:58:02 AM) s10: mriedem: i've tested this patches in our small testing environment with Pike. I created one fake nova-compute with 10000 instances.
(9:58:02 AM) s10: mriedem: without any patches function _get_instances_by_host() for this fake host gets instances in 15 seconds, with merged patch (569218) ? in 8 seconds, with the last patch (569247, Trim the fat on HostState.instances) ? in 5 seconds.
(9:58:02 AM) s10: mriedem: for other hosts speed increase are comparable, 0.05-0.10 seconds per host becomes 0.02-0.04, depending on the number of instances.

Granted, you're not going to have 10K instances on a single compute host."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-24 15:14:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-07-24 16:56:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-17 20:09:58.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Trim the fat on HostState.instances

The only in-tree filters that rely on HostState.instances
are the affinity filters (and one of the weighers). And they
don't even look at the values in the HostState.instances dict,
just the keys (which are the instance uuids for the instances
on the host).

So rather than pull the full instance objects, we can just get
the list of instance uuids off the host and fake out the object.

This adds a new config option for anyone that has out of tree
filters that do rely on HostState.instances.values() for looking
at the actual instance objects.

Related to blueprint put-host-manager-instance-info-on-a-diet

Related-Bug: #1737465

TODO: reno for the config option (and probably rename it for feelings)
TODO: make InstanceList.get_uuids_by_host smarter

Change-Id: I766bb5645e3b598468d092fb9e4f18e720617c52
"}, {'created': '2018-05-17 21:17:33.000000000', 'message': "Trim the fat on HostState.instances

This adds a new config option for anyone that has out of tree
filters that do rely on HostState.instances.values() for looking
at the actual instance objects.

Related to blueprint put-host-manager-instance-info-on-a-diet

Related-Bug: #1737465

Change-Id: I766bb5645e3b598468d092fb9e4f18e720617c52
"}, {'created': '2018-06-01 16:17:28.000000000', 'message': "Trim the fat on HostState.instances

The only in-tree filters that rely on HostState.instances
are the affinity filters (and one of the weighers). And they
don't even look at the values in the HostState.instances dict,
just the keys (which are the instance uuids for the instances
on the host).

So rather than pull the full instance objects, we can just get
the list of instance uuids off the host and fake out the object.

Custom filters/weighers will still be able to lazy-load fields
on the Instance objects in HostState.instances if needed, but
it will mean a performance penalty due to the round trip to the
database per instance, per host. Out of tree filters/weighers
are encouraged to be contributed upstream.

Related to blueprint put-host-manager-instance-info-on-a-diet

Related-Bug: #1737465

Change-Id: I766bb5645e3b598468d092fb9e4f18e720617c52
"}]
commit_message:
Trim the fat on HostState.instances

The only in-tree filters that rely on HostState.instances
are the affinity filters (and one of the weighers). And they
don't even look at the values in the HostState.instances dict,
just the keys (which are the instance uuids for the instances
on the host).

So rather than pull the full instance objects, we can just get
the list of instance uuids off the host and fake out the object.

Custom filters/weighers will still be able to lazy-load fields
on the Instance objects in HostState.instances if needed, but
it will mean a performance penalty due to the round trip to the
database per instance, per host. Out of tree filters/weighers
are encouraged to be contributed upstream.

Related to blueprint put-host-manager-instance-info-on-a-diet

Related-Bug: #1737465

Change-Id: I766bb5645e3b598468d092fb9e4f18e720617c52

Commit 48b8973aed73e9dc88288607aecc4da6a69d94ac made it required to
provide a size when creating a volume, but when creating a volume from a
snapshot it is not necessary. If size is provided, and larger than the

commit_message:
Don't require size when creating volume from snap

Commit 48b8973aed73e9dc88288607aecc4da6a69d94ac made it required to
provide a size when creating a volume, but when creating a volume from a
snapshot it is not necessary. If size is provided, and larger than the
snapshot size, that will be used, but otherwise it should default to
just use the original snapshot size for the volume.

Change-Id: Ia7056758bbb678f8c31ecd96863d0918eb91aa70
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Allow passing in service types with _ in them

-'s vs. _'s is a thing people can get wrong from time to time. If
someone says "I want block_storage" - we know what they mean - or at
least we can.

Change-Id: I97c65c25ae8e787f4bfedab54db619d98a16f037

default tables row's external_ids column if 'bridge_interface_mappings' param

commit_message:
Set mac-table-size for provider bridges defined in 'ovn_bridge_mappings'

The default mac table size may not be sufficient for the provider bridges.
If the mac table overflows, it has been observed that ovs-vswitchd clocks
100% CPU. So this patch configures the mac table size of the provider bridges.
It defaults to 50000 if the value is not specified.

This patch also clears the ovn-bridge-mappings property from the OpenvSwitch's
default tables row's external_ids column if 'bridge_interface_mappings' param
is not set.

Change-Id: I8f392c7807c4c6a152dfa4b77c7f4350b44324c0
Closes-bug: #1779706
Closes-bug: #1774847

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-17 08:58:16.000000000', 'message': "Generate additional roles with defined roles file

NFV cluster deployment should have the parameters closely
associated with hardware and NUMA spec, in which case, the same
role hast to be duplicated to associate the hardware groups. This
patch adds the support to generate the roles_data file with
additional roles from the the defined roles by only chaning few
properties.

openstack overcloud roles generate ComputeOvsDpdk:ComputeOvsDpdkDell \
    ComputeOvsDpdk:ComptueOvsDpdkHp -o roles_data.yaml

This command allows to use the defined role (ComputeOvsDpdk) to be
generated as 2 different roles by changing the 'name' and
'HostnameFormatDefault' contents alone. This reduces the copy paste
mistakes on generating multiple roles in a cluster with same services.

Change-Id: Ifa60eae1ad09b2ceac207114c40c714a6fc67cbc

commit_message:
Generate additional roles with defined roles file

NFV cluster deployment should have the parameters closely
associated with hardware and NUMA spec, in which case, the same
role has to be duplicated to associate the hardware groups. This
patch adds the support to generate the roles_data file with
additional roles from the existing defined roles by only changing
few properties.

openstack overcloud roles generate ComputeOvsDpdk:ComputeOvsDpdkDell \
    ComputeOvsDpdk:ComptueOvsDpdkHp -o roles_data.yaml

This command allows to use the defined role (ComputeOvsDpdk) to be
generated as 2 different roles by changing the 'name' alone. This
reduces the copy paste mistakes in generating multiple roles in a
cluster with same services.
Closes-Bug: #1782322

Change-Id: Ifa60eae1ad09b2ceac207114c40c714a6fc67cbc

commit_message:
Stub out check for OVS installed to avoid failing tests

The tests for the method that checks to see if OVS is installed
only pass if OVS is not installed. This change stubs out the
function so the tests pass on systems with OVS.

Closes-bug: #1783240

Change-Id: I70bee7a7556aada186ccec89dbe800c8eb870aa5

subject: Add default roles used by Barbican
messages:
[{'account_id': 26647, 'date': '2018-07-10 16:57:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26647, 'date': '2018-07-10 16:59:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-11 07:25:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

Hello. Thank you for your patch!

Our process wait for master implementation to merge before providing a patch in stable branches. In those stable branches patches, a reference to the original patch (a mention of the "cherry-pick") is added.

I am administratively adding a -2 to this patch, to make sure it doesn't merge until the master patch has been properly vetted.

Please contact me if you have a problem with this.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-11 07:27:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Hello. Thank you for your patch!
 > 
 > Our process wait for master implementation to merge before
 > providing a patch in stable branches. In those stable branches
 > patches, a reference to the original patch (a mention of the
 > "cherry-pick") is added.
 > 
 > I am administratively adding a -2 to this patch, to make sure it
 > doesn't merge until the master patch has been properly vetted.
 > 
 > Please contact me if you have a problem with this.

This comment applies even if it's a re-implementation: Please wait for master patch to be approved first.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-17 12:21:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

If this is a cherry pick of a patch, please make sure it's listed, like doing this:
(cherry picked from commit 0ed71b4f48c847cd167c2303713f341501803a0c)"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-17 12:25:23.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-1 by Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-07-17 12:26:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Please update the commit message explaining it's a re-implementation of patch in master branch. (So we can track easily the how and why)."}, {'account_id': 26647, 'date': '2018-07-17 12:59:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-24 20:26:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-24 20:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Superceded by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585540/1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-10 16:57:04.000000000', 'message': 'Add default roles used by Barbican

The default roles used by Barbican are missing.
According to the policy.json the Key Manager
comes with, four roles have to be defined.

Change-Id: Ice4071824c8ce00de5e0dc7f4a1df8450c5fdbb1
Closes-Bug: #1657742
'}, {'created': '2018-07-10 16:59:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add default roles used by Barbican

The default roles used by Barbican are missing.
According to the policy.json the Key Manager
comes with, four roles have to be defined.

Change-Id: Ice4071824c8ce00de5e0dc7f4a1df8450c5fdbb1
Closes-Bug: #1657742
'}, {'created': '2018-07-17 12:59:24.000000000', 'message': "Add default roles used by Barbican

The default roles used by Barbican are missing.
According to the default policy.json the roles
'key-manager:service-admin', 'creator',
'observer', 'audit' are necessary for Barbican.

This is reimplementation of the 0ed71b4 because
keystone module is used in stable/queens.

Change-Id: Ice4071824c8ce00de5e0dc7f4a1df8450c5fdbb1
Closes-Bug: #1657742
"}]
commit_message:
Add default roles used by Barbican

The default roles used by Barbican are missing.
According to the default policy.json the roles
'key-manager:service-admin', 'creator',
'observer', 'audit' are necessary for Barbican.

This is reimplementation of the 0ed71b4 because
keystone module is used in stable/queens.

Change-Id: Ice4071824c8ce00de5e0dc7f4a1df8450c5fdbb1
Closes-Bug: #1657742

commit_message:
Add logrotate to the elasticstack

To ensure we're not creating too many logs files the logrotate config
has been added to truncate and compress log files every other day
with a max retention priod of 5 days.

Change-Id: I0dd85a334dba48e9fce3aad67ead867e2f46cb02
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Update/correct vrrp check for haproxy

The socat use was more or less legit, but checking PID file and
related process is a more convenient way - especially NOT involving
any pipe in docker command.

This also converge with the puppet-tripleo check change:
Ib5050a3a6af262e26b5523974d1d4a80c4e92834

Change-Id: I576c4c7d0645169356d4d77493387603f0719656

/usr/bin/systemctl status haproxy.service exited with status 1

Even if the undercloud is currently not in HA, it's still a good thing
to get clean logs.

Note: the command is launched by the keepalived container, hence we
cannot use pgrep nor anything else. We also need the /var/lib/haproxy
mount in the keepalived container, shared from the haproxy container on
the host.

Change-Id: Ib5050a3a6af262e26b5523974d1d4a80c4e92834

cannot use pgrep nor anything else. We also need the /var/lib/haproxy

the host.

Change-Id: Ib5050a3a6af262e26b5523974d1d4a80c4e92834
"}]
commit_message:
Correct vrrp script for haproxy status

Currently, on a containerized undercloud, we get error messages from
keepalived container:
/usr/bin/systemctl status haproxy.service exited with status 1

Even if the undercloud is currently not in HA, it's still a good thing
to get clean logs.

Note: the command is launched by the keepalived container, hence we
cannot use pgrep nor anything else. We also need the /var/lib/haproxy
mount in the keepalived container, shared from the haproxy container on
the host.

Change-Id: Ib5050a3a6af262e26b5523974d1d4a80c4e92834

commit_message:
Add rabbitmq/oslomsg services

The rabbitmq/oslomsg groups are now required by the
keystone role, so we add them to the inventory and
ensure that the test playbook install the services.

Also, the multi-region tests are set to non-voting
to unblock the swift repo for other patches to
resolve the issue.

Change-Id: I4e2bbdff7a89b204723e7937667854c412051347

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should
migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ia64e4e4e44bc8ce7a86b471b0e60599fb285699f

subject: Configure keepalived before rabbitmq
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-07-24 06:51:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-07-24 12:48:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 06:51:40.000000000', 'message': "Configure keepalived before rabbitmq

Sometimes an undercloud could fail to install with the following error:
2018-05-29 12:53:17,588 INFO: May 29 12:53:08 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Starting RabbitMQ broker...
2018-05-29 12:53:17,588 INFO: May 29 12:53:11 foo.int.bar rabbitmq-server[14327]: ERROR: epmd error for host foo: address (cannot connect to host/port)
2018-05-29 12:53:17,588 INFO: May 29 12:53:11 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: rabbitmq-server.service: main process exited, code=exited, status=1/FAILURE

1) The hostname of the box is
foo.int.bar foo

and in the hosts file we have the following entry: 192.168.248.2
192.168.248.2 foo.int.bar foo

Note: 192.168.248.2 is a VIP managed by keepalived because we configured this
undercloud to be an SSL one so we have:
undercloud_public_host = 192.168.248.2

2) At this stage we see rabbitmq-server being started:
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Starting Flexible Branding Service...
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: epmd@0.0.0.0.socket failed to listen on sockets: Address already in use
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Failed to listen on Erlang Port Mapper Daemon Activation Socket.
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Unit epmd@0.0.0.0.socket entered failed state.
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Starting Erlang Port Mapper Daemon Activation Socket.
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Starting RabbitMQ broker...
Jan 27 06:46:34 foo.int.bar rabbitmq-server[14532]: ERROR: epmd error for host foo: address (cannot connect to host/port)

Now epmd might have already been up (and normally the failed message is
not particularly concerning). But the real problem is that we are trying
to connect to foo which maps to a VIP, but the VIP gets started only
later by keepalived:
3)
Jan 27 07:02:30 foo.int.bar Keepalived_vrrp[914]: VRRP_Instance(42) Sending/queueing gratuitous ARPs on br-ctlplane for 192.168.248.2
Jan 27 07:02:30 foo.int.bar Keepalived_vrrp[914]: Sending gratuitous ARP on br-ctlplane for 192.168.248.2

Let's make sure keepalived is up and running before rabbitmq in order to
fix this.

Change-Id: I010102b01e41610838c836a743a07be1965944d6
Closes-Bug: #1782814
(cherry picked from commit c3ccb92d64e7ee724d7d2f28d138894805d41629)
"}]
commit_message:
Configure keepalived before rabbitmq

Sometimes an undercloud could fail to install with the following error:
2018-05-29 12:53:17,588 INFO: May 29 12:53:08 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Starting RabbitMQ broker...
2018-05-29 12:53:17,588 INFO: May 29 12:53:11 foo.int.bar rabbitmq-server[14327]: ERROR: epmd error for host foo: address (cannot connect to host/port)
2018-05-29 12:53:17,588 INFO: May 29 12:53:11 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: rabbitmq-server.service: main process exited, code=exited, status=1/FAILURE

1) The hostname of the box is
foo.int.bar foo

and in the hosts file we have the following entry: 192.168.248.2
192.168.248.2 foo.int.bar foo

Note: 192.168.248.2 is a VIP managed by keepalived because we configured this
undercloud to be an SSL one so we have:
undercloud_public_host = 192.168.248.2

2) At this stage we see rabbitmq-server being started:
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Starting Flexible Branding Service...
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: epmd@0.0.0.0.socket failed to listen on sockets: Address already in use
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Failed to listen on Erlang Port Mapper Daemon Activation Socket.
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Unit epmd@0.0.0.0.socket entered failed state.
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Starting Erlang Port Mapper Daemon Activation Socket.
Jan 27 06:46:31 foo.int.bar systemd[1]: Starting RabbitMQ broker...
Jan 27 06:46:34 foo.int.bar rabbitmq-server[14532]: ERROR: epmd error for host foo: address (cannot connect to host/port)

Now epmd might have already been up (and normally the failed message is
not particularly concerning). But the real problem is that we are trying
to connect to foo which maps to a VIP, but the VIP gets started only
later by keepalived:
3)
Jan 27 07:02:30 foo.int.bar Keepalived_vrrp[914]: VRRP_Instance(42) Sending/queueing gratuitous ARPs on br-ctlplane for 192.168.248.2
Jan 27 07:02:30 foo.int.bar Keepalived_vrrp[914]: Sending gratuitous ARP on br-ctlplane for 192.168.248.2

Let's make sure keepalived is up and running before rabbitmq in order to
fix this.

Change-Id: I010102b01e41610838c836a743a07be1965944d6
Closes-Bug: #1782814
(cherry picked from commit c3ccb92d64e7ee724d7d2f28d138894805d41629)

commit_message:
Update retention policy weighting

This change adds retention policy weighting based on experience with the
indexes in production in large scale clouds.

Change-Id: I0d09d4cfc68f70fe790170d5d54f1585616c5524
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'created': '2017-11-24 14:49:41.000000000', 'message': 'Update swift for replication issues

There are corresponding image changes to go with these ansible
changes - changes in rsyncd template, and add
environment settings for RSYNC_CONNECT_PROG (i.e. nc)

nc allows for rsync replication to easily target {{ swift_rsync_port }}

update the lock file and chroot settings in template - see bug
for more details.

Closes-Bug: #1733851
'}]
commit_message:
Update swift for replication issues

There are corresponding image changes to go with these ansible
changes - changes in rsyncd template, and add
environment settings for RSYNC_CONNECT_PROG (i.e. nc)

nc allows for rsync replication to easily target {{ swift_rsync_port }}

update the lock file and chroot settings in template - see bug
for more details.

Change-Id: Ic81b7de8fad8aec9416e4e27e8ffda6d03be293c
Closes-Bug: #1733851

[{'created': '2017-11-06 18:23:29.000000000', 'message': "Define constants for Neutron client resource types

Use named constants to pass as the 'resource' parameter to the
find_resourceid_by_name_or_id() method of the Neutron client plugin.

Apart from making everything more explicit and less error-prone, this also
provides clarity on the meaning of obtuse names like 'policy' (QoS, not
any other kind of policy) or 'pool' (load balancer, not subnet).

Change-Id: If9b5528835775d303db477fafabf3ed6bd224bd0
"}, {'created': '2017-11-06 20:10:15.000000000', 'message': "Define constants for Neutron client resource types

Use named constants to pass as the 'resource' parameter to the
find_resourceid_by_name_or_id() method of the Neutron client plugin.

Apart from making everything more explicit and less error-prone, this also
provides clarity on the meaning of obtuse names like 'policy' (QoS, not

Change-Id: If9b5528835775d303db477fafabf3ed6bd224bd0
"}]
commit_message:
Define constants for Neutron client resource types

Use named constants to pass as the 'resource' parameter to the
find_resourceid_by_name_or_id() method of the Neutron client plugin.

Apart from making everything more explicit and less error-prone, this also
provides clarity on the meaning of obtuse names like 'policy' (QoS, not
any other kind of policy) or 'pool' (load balancer, not subnet).

Change-Id: If9b5528835775d303db477fafabf3ed6bd224bd0

commit_message:
Include file content in scenario tests

Use the heatclient utilities for loading referenced files and passing them
in the files dict when running scenario tests. This allows testing nested
stack scenarios in a way that is representative of how users would
encounter them.

Change-Id: I6693a0a9e0e1af42b69ade12c8da6f12d370eb49
Story: #1739447
Task: 22218

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 09:05:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix is_default value is empty when create share type

This bug is from path[1], when we use manila client to create a
share type, the is_default value is always empty, if fix [1] only
in manila client, lots of unit test breakage, so add the
is_default_type value when we create each share type.

[1] Ib264d8422fe57701f990cbbf7ea5d1e90b8b0008
Closes-bug: #1743941

Change-Id: Ia8bcb632591fc0b5438847b22ec59c2039ecf5f1
'}, {'created': '2018-03-28 11:02:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix is_default value is empty when create share type

is_default_type value when we create each share type.

commit_message:
Retrieve is_default value to fix empty display in CLI

This bug is from path[1], when we use manila client to create
a share type or share group type, the is_default value is always
empty, so add the is_default value when we create each share type
or share group type.

Closes-bug: #1743941
[1] Ib264d8422fe57701f990cbbf7ea5d1e90b8b0008

Change-Id: Ia8bcb632591fc0b5438847b22ec59c2039ecf5f1

commit_message:
Add additional log of meta_data devices content

In TaggedAttachmentsTest.test_tagged_attachment test there is
now added some additional debug log to check what
devices are still in meta_data's devices field when it should
be empty already.

This patch changes also from handling all exeptions to only
AssertionError in verify_empty_devices() method.
If exeption other than AssertionError occur, it will not be silently
ignored anymore.

Change-Id: I95016e35102569fba79fc58f9695e480234619dc
Related-Bug: #1775947

Could you clarify what do you mean by "final decision final of neutron on how to keep the old behaviour" . Slawek Kaplonski is the Neutron QA Liaison and he has gave a +1 on this patch. You are waiting for a PTL +1 or something else?

Please note that we are not able to proceed on neutron side without this patch getting merged since the gate will complain.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-06-28 21:47:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

So this fix LGTM, but won't approve until Ghanshyam confirms"}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-06-28 21:48:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

 > waiting for a PTL +1 or something else?
 > 
 > Please note that we are not able to proceed on neutron side without
 > this patch getting merged since the gate will complain.

I wanted to know what is final way to keep the old behaviour from neutron side? from api-wg log i found mlavalle mentioned it will be done via extensions mechanism and in commit message you mentioned via config option which confused me. If you give ref of neutron patch of doing that logic or doc in commit msg then it will be good. 

slaweq confirmation is enough here but looking for answer to above query.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-06-29 14:16:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I wanted to know what is final way to keep the old behaviour from
 > neutron side? from api-wg log i found mlavalle mentioned it will be
 > done via extensions mechanism and in commit message you mentioned
 > via config option which confused me. If you give ref of neutron
 > patch of doing that logic or doc in commit msg then it will be
 > good.

It is done by both. There will be an extension to indicate this new API behavior (which is primarily for end-users to discover the change), and there will be an config option to turn off this feature (which is for cloud admin to maintain backward-compatibility if they chose to do that).

Here is the patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574907/ .'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-06-29 14:25:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

 > It is done by both. There will be an extension to indicate this new
 > API behavior (which is primarily for end-users to discover the
 > change), and there will be an config option to turn off this
 > feature (which is for cloud admin to maintain backward-compatibility
 > if they chose to do that).
 > 
 > Here is the patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574907/ .

Hmm, now I wonder that maybe it would be good to make it "discoverable" here as well. So if this new extension would be available, test would work in new way, if extension is not available, test like it was done before.
So if there will be no extension, test will use wrong parameter and check if this backward compatibility is fine. What You think about it?'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-06-29 15:28:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-06-29 17:17:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-06-29 17:51:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-18 21:44:13.000000000', 'message': "Correct the usage on listing floating ips

The test case uses 'network' as a query parameter, but this is
an invalid parameter. In before, the test passed because neutron
server ignored this parameter. However, neutron is not going to
ignore invalid inputs anymore. This patch replaces 'network' with
'floating_network_id'.

Change-Id: Iad1c82bf85167498deaf731f048e29060558a95c
"}, {'created': '2018-06-22 14:37:26.000000000', 'message': 'Correct the usage on listing floating ips

The test case uses 'network' as a query parameter, but this is
an invalid parameter. In before, the test passed because neutron
server ignored this parameter.

However, neutron is planing to employ a strict validation validation
against filter parameters [1]. The motivation is to algin with the
OpenStack API guideline [2]. In particular, the API guideline
mentioned the following:

"... if the API supports query parameters and a request
contains an unknown or unsupported parameter, the server should
return a 400 Bad Request response. Invalid values in the request URL
should never be silently ignored, as the response may not match the
client‚Äôs expectation..."

After discussion with the API work group [3], the neutron team decides
to make a backward-incompatible change (with a config option to
rollback to the old API behavior).

If the validation logic is implemented, invalid query parameter like
'network' will be rejected and neutron will give a 400 response.
This patch replaces 'network' with 'floating_network_id'.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1749820
[2] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/http/
    response-codes.html#failure-code-clarifications
[3] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/api_sig/2018/
    api_sig.2018-03-15-16.00.log.html#l-120

Change-Id: Iad1c82bf85167498deaf731f048e29060558a95c
'}, {'created': '2018-06-29 15:28:23.000000000', 'message': 'Correct the usage on listing floating ips

The test case uses 'network' as a query parameter, but this is
an invalid parameter. In before, the test passed because neutron
server ignored this parameter.

against filter parameters [1]. The motivation is to algin with the
OpenStack API guideline [2]. In particular, the API guideline
mentioned the following:

"... if the API supports query parameters and a request
contains an unknown or unsupported parameter, the server should
return a 400 Bad Request response. Invalid values in the request URL
should never be silently ignored, as the response may not match the
client‚Äôs expectation..."

After discussion with the API work group [3], the neutron team decides
to make a backward-incompatible change (with a config option to
rollback to the old API behavior).

If the validation logic is implemented, invalid query parameter like
'network' will be rejected and neutron will give a 400 response.
This patch replaces 'network' with 'floating_network_id' if the
extension 'filter-validation' is presented.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1749820

commit_message:
Correct the usage on listing floating ips

The test case uses 'network' as a query parameter, but this is
an invalid parameter. In before, the test passed because neutron
server silently ignored this parameter and returned all the
floating IPs, which happened to make the test pass.

Change-Id: Iad1c82bf85167498deaf731f048e29060558a95c

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated in Queens [1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I43bbc8b8c986e54a9a0829a0631d78d4077306f8
(cherry picked from commit 708b24aef11f8a78f5bbc7c17d3199f8f8fc74c5)

commit_message:
Fix Ansible Using tests as filters is deprecated

Avoids deprecation warnings like below by adopting recommended syntax.

[DEPRECATION WARNING]: Using tests as filters is deprecated. Instead of
using `result|failed` instead use `result is failed`. This feature will
be removed in version 2.9. Deprecation warnings can be disabled by
setting deprecation_warnings=False in ansible.cfg.

Change-Id: Ie0e0fbc61090e2b89971252ee60700158acf5fd4
Signed-off-by: Sorin Sbarnea <ssbarnea@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update project depth check

when a hierarchical limit enforcement model is deployed
by keystone, the project hierarchical depth should
not break the limit model as well.

This patch updated the project depth check function
to fix the problem.

bp: strict-two-level-model
Change-Id: I695fedcf83bdca2946a2c5d876052c02b0f63810

commit_message:
Add include_limits filter

Add include_limits filter for get project to support
fetching project hierarchy limits.

This filter should be used together with "subtree_as_list"
or "parents_as_list" filter

bp: strict-two-level-model
Change-Id: Ib602887c92b89be0ffec1394a3076f5dd5671511

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-10 06:21:18.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I145e928c29c7e496112c680db54cd8412b2fd0a6
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I145e928c29c7e496112c680db54cd8412b2fd0a6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-19 15:18:20.000000000', 'message': "Correct the usage on listing neutron ports

The test case uses 'fixed_ip' as a query parameter, but the usage
is not correct. In before, the test passed because neutron
server ignored this parameter, and returned all the
ports, which happened to make the test pass.

This patch fixes the usage of this parameter. If there is no ip_address
then not to filter the list using the filter. Otherwise,
we use 'fixed_ips' parameter and populate its value correctly.

Change-Id: If4e9b364b0971b56e9c15ea65d3b3c9177d0bf22
"}]
commit_message:
Correct the usage on listing neutron ports

The test case uses 'fixed_ip' as a query parameter, but the usage
is not correct. In before, the test passed because neutron
server ignored this parameter, and returned all the
ports, which happened to make the test pass.

This patch fixes the usage of this parameter. If there is no ip_address
then not to filter the list using the filter. Otherwise,
we use 'fixed_ips' parameter and populate its value correctly.

Change-Id: If4e9b364b0971b56e9c15ea65d3b3c9177d0bf22

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-23 15:45:52.000000000', 'message': 'copy ceph config in manila-share container bundle

The pacemaker manila-share docker configuration was
set up on the assumption that /etc/ceph on the host
is bind-mounted directly to /etc/ceph in the manila-share
container, but since [1] this is no longer true.  Ceph
configuration follows the pattern wherein the ceph
configuration and keys are bind-mounted into the container
at /var/lib/kolla/config_files/src-ceph/.

So set the docker kolla config for the pacemaker
bundled manila share to copy the contents of
/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src-ceph to /etc/ceph in
the container as is done in the non-pacemaker service
and as is done with cinder-volume service with both
the pacemaker and non-pacemaker versions of the
service.

Closes-Bug: #1783149

Change-Id: If6cb5e7bd0a5d7952ab43dffddb0e8eaf4952a0d
'}, {'created': '2018-07-24 09:49:07.000000000', 'message': 'copy ceph config in manila-share container bundle

Change-Id: If6cb5e7bd0a5d7952ab43dffddb0e8eaf4952a0d

commit_message:
copy ceph config in manila-share container bundle

The pacemaker manila-share docker configuration was
set up on the assumption that /etc/ceph on the host
is bind-mounted directly to /etc/ceph in the manila-share
container, but since [1] this is no longer true.  Ceph
configuration follows the pattern wherein the ceph
configuration and keys are bind-mounted into the container
at /var/lib/kolla/config_files/src-ceph/.

So set the docker kolla config for the pacemaker
bundled manila share to copy the contents of
/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src-ceph to /etc/ceph in
the container as is done in the non-pacemaker service
and as is done with cinder-volume service with both
the pacemaker and non-pacemaker versions of the
service.

Closes-Bug: #1783149

[1] I66a76d3226d5a1d3e0b5387326305d1f3313a340

Change-Id: If6cb5e7bd0a5d7952ab43dffddb0e8eaf4952a0d

[{'created': '2018-07-16 06:15:40.000000000', 'message': 'Api-ref: change fix ``extra-spec-key`` key in path

TrivialFix:
In the API Unset an extra spec:
/v2/{tenant_id}/types/{share_type_id}/extra_specs/{extra-spec-key}
the key extra-spec-key should be in path, but it is in body, this
is to fix this.

Change-Id: Ia6f01a6bca369ca4b922a45e8e6ece4f583528c7
'}]
commit_message:
Api-ref: change fix ``extra-spec-key`` key in path

TrivialFix:
In the API Unset an extra spec:
/v2/{tenant_id}/types/{share_type_id}/extra_specs/{extra-spec-key}
the key extra-spec-key should be in path, but it is in body, this
is to fix this.

Change-Id: Ia6f01a6bca369ca4b922a45e8e6ece4f583528c7

subject: py36: Fix test_get_logger_sysloghandler_plumbing
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-06-21 22:43:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-06-21 22:48:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is that the right Python bug link? That one only talks about lack of IPv6 support, not when hostname resolution is performed.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-06-21 22:53:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yup; it makes more sense when you look at the patch: https://github.com/python/cpython/pull/1676/files

Previously, it'd create the socket passing in the hostname, and not actually connect to it since we're using SOCK_DGRAM. Now, it does a getaddrinfo (which performs resolution) and tries IP addresses until it can create a socket.

Maybe could use more of an explanation? I thought about linking to an individual patch, but it turns out this got backported to 3.6, 3.5, and even 2.7, so it wasn't obvious *which* patch to link to."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-06-21 22:56:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Ah, the Python patch makes it clear.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-07-24 18:28:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit e2cfc98dd8c89e70bffeca83e3497fc7708b3eb6'}]

'}]

commit_message:
Add ability to filter version data by service-type

The get_all_version_data method is useful for getting a full listing of
what's going on with version discovery on a cloud. Sometimes though
people just want to see the versions for a specific service. Add a
filter to allow skipping making the version discovery call in the first
place, instead of needing to do that as a post-filtering step.

Change-Id: Ia3ca4be2976d1a5e7914fa8f2adbf7297e8cb1e1

commit_message:
DNM: run glance_store tips jobs as experimental

Some big changes are being merged into glance_store.  This patch
allows us to run the glane tests against glance_store master on
demand, instead of waiting for the periodic job to run.

Change-Id: I7ca83e8d9af19aba59388278e055415ca9bf36e5

It would be nice to see a functional test in here.  Ideally, it would:

- Crank up the compute service and then query placement directly to assert that the expected traits are in place.
- Set/unset some traits directly via placement - some that compute "owns" and some it doesn't.
- Make sure update_provider_tree runs, by ensuring periodics hit and/or by restarting the compute service.
- Assert that the compute-owned traits are set correctly (any added above are removed; any removed above are re-added) and the non-compute-owned ones are unaffected.'}, {'account_id': 16150, 'date': '2018-06-12 07:26:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-06-12 08:57:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

So, looking at the logs for the IBM Power CI, Nova didn't even get to generate the guest XML.  It failed right before, when the baselineCPU() API is called with 'ppc64le' argument and libvirt rightfully complained:
---
Jul 19 11:28:51.096721 devstack-xenial-ppc64-284262 nova-compute[24588]: ERROR nova.compute.manager     if ret is None: raise libvirtError ('virConnectBaselineCPU() failed', conn=self)
Jul 19 11:28:51.096881 devstack-xenial-ppc64-284262 nova-compute[24588]: ERROR nova.compute.manager libvirtError: internal error: Unknown CPU model ppc64le
---

The "normal" way to use the baselineCPU() API is to grab the <cpu> element from the capabilities XML of all the Compute nodes in a cluser and feed that to the API.  But in POWER KVM scenario, we apparently will _not_ get the best result.

Talking to a libvirt developer (thanks: Andrea Bolognani) who sometimes works with IBM Power KVM, the recommendation for Power guests is to use 'power8' as the CPU model:

    <cpu mode='host-model'><model>power8</model></cpu>

That will also ensure you'll be able to migrate Power8 guests to Power9 hosts and so forth.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-19 14:52:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24:

So, if the recommendation is for the powerkvm CI job configuration to change, do we hold up this change on that happening? Need to talk to their CI people but I'm not getting a response from mmedvede."}, {'account_id': 16150, 'date': '2018-07-19 15:03:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24:

(1 comment)

Thanks Kashyap, if I get your point right, the reason Power Ci failed is because I use wrong cpu model. From the conf Matt pasted, with cpu_mode not specified, the code will try to guess a cpu model from cpu arch, which is 'ppc64le'. I misused 'ppc64le' as the cpu model passed to baselinecall and caused the error. So the answer is if arch is 'pppc64le' a model of 'power8' should be used, right?"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-19 15:39:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

> From the conf Matt pasted, with cpu_mode not specified

cpu_mode is specified with value "none" which is not the same as unspecified (None).'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-19 15:48:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2018-07-20 12:54:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

> So the xml passed to baseline call is:
 > <cpu mode="host-model" match="exact">
 > <arch>ppc64le</arch>
 > <model>power8</model>
 > </cpu>

The above is wrong‚Äîthe baselineCPU() takes *host* CPUs, and not the 
*guest* CPU XML (which is what you have above); hence the error.  

As I noted earlier, the baselineCPU() takes input as the <cpu> element
from the capabilities XML of all the hosts in your cluster (as part of a
single file), so that you can arrive at the "baseline" that works for
all the guests.

What you need to provide to baselineCPU() is something like the
following:

    <cpu>
      <arch>ppc64</arch>
      <model>POWER7</model>
      <vendor>IBM</vendor>
      <topology sockets='2' cores='4' threads='1'/>
    </cpu>
    <cpu>
      <arch>ppc64</arch>
      <model>POWER8</model>
      <vendor>IBM</vendor>
      <topology sockets='1' cores='1' threads='1'/>
    </cpu>

 > maybe the arch tag makes libvirt thinks it's not a guest cpu, I'll
 > remove arch and try again.

No, that won't work either.  Please refer to the above what I wrote.'}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2018-07-20 12:58:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 27: Code-Review-1

For some inspiration, take a look at all the 'ppc64-baseline-*' files here:

https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=tree;hb=HEAD;f=tests/cputestdata

(NB: if you are directly copy / pasting from one of the the above files, make sure you remove </cpuTest>.)"}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-07-20 13:16:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

commit_message:
Add method to get cpu traits

Add a method for libvirt driver to get cpu traits.
This is used for compute nodes to report cpu traits to Placement.

Change-Id: I9bd80adc244c64277d2d00e7d79c3002c8f9d57e
blueprint: report-cpu-features-as-traits

commit_message:
Ensure orders policy-in-code matches controller

Policy-in-code for orders API did not map properly to orders
controller. Moved `ordeR:put` rule to `orderS:put` to all in line
with what is expected.

Change-Id: I18fc3e9d2772e3f9813aad2a79e8864cf0511abf

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 07:30:37.000000000', 'message': 'Run ansible tests against specific public cloud

We want to run ansible tests against some public cloud, but
there are always some API policy limits for regular users in
public cloud, like: can not create external network. So we define
some variables that can be changed for different limit scenairoes.

1. Create port in external or internal network.
2. Specified public pool name when launching server.
3. Create simple router, then add interface and external gateway,
   change test step order, so that admin operation failing at the end
   when regular user run the case.
4. Create subnet with enable_dhcp true or false.
5. Make ANSIBLE_VAR_* environment variables can be passed into virtual
   env.

Change-Id: I69473756b23a6cb525e0f9bb40d09e6ed9880782
'}, {'created': '2018-07-13 08:22:05.000000000', 'message': 'Run ansible tests against specific public cloud

there are always some API policy limits for regular users in
public cloud, like: can not create external network. So we define
some variables that can be changed for different limit scenairoes.

1. Create port in external or internal network.
2. Specified public pool name when launching server.
3. Create simple router, then add interface and external gateway,
   change test step order, so that do not create external network
   when network_external=false.
4. Create subnet with enable_dhcp true or false.
5. Make ANSIBLE_VAR_* environment variables can be passed into virtual
   env.

Change-Id: I69473756b23a6cb525e0f9bb40d09e6ed9880782

commit_message:
Run ansible tests against specific public cloud

We want to run ansible tests against some public cloud, but
there are always some API policy limits for regular users in
public cloud, like: can not create external network. So we define
some variables that can be changed for different limit scenairoes.

1. Create port in external or internal network.
2. Specified public pool name when launching server.
3. Create simple router, then add interface and external gateway,
   change test step order, so that do not create external network
   when network_external=false.
4. Create subnet with enable_dhcp true or false.
5. Make ANSIBLE_VAR_* environment variables can be passed into virtual
   env.

Change-Id: I69473756b23a6cb525e0f9bb40d09e6ed9880782
