commit_message:
Collectd QDR connection

This patch enables to configure collectd to QDR by utilizing
collectd-amqp1 plugin.

Change-Id: I4cb6aa95e253b7fd19ed265fbcba0dfe6663592d

subject: Allow AIO to automatically use an http proxy
messages:
[{'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-07-23 08:43:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-07-23 09:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-07-23 09:30:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 19578, 'date': '2018-07-23 09:58:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I can not remember exactly the details of what I have been told and by whom earlier this year but concerning the deployment behind proxy node it seems that setting deployment_environment_variables is preferrer over global_environment_variables like this patch suggest. Anyways this is the way I do it all the time without any issue. May be OSA core team member could comment more appropriately on this'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-07-23 10:34:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-07-23 11:01:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> I can not remember exactly the details of what I have been told and
 > by whom earlier this year but concerning the deployment behind
 > proxy node it seems that setting deployment_environment_variables
 > is preferrer over global_environment_variables like this patch
 > suggest. Anyways this is the way I do it all the time without any
 > issue. May be OSA core team member could comment more appropriately
 > on this

There is documentation about the differences and use cases for deployment time and persistent environment variables here https://docs.openstack.org/openstack-ansible/queens/user/limited-connectivity/index.html.

It is really the deployers choice until the size of the deployment becomes so large that no_proxy exceeds 1024 chars in the case of "global_environment_variables".'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-24 09:37:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-24 15:09:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Allow AIO to automatically use an http proxy

This change allows an AIO to automatically configure appropriate
settings in global_environment_variables to deploy correctly behind
an http proxy. This gives two benefits, new users behind proxies
are less likley to fail, and CI behind proxies can test AIO deployments
without having to apply any additional configuration.

Change-Id: Ib094d61762078a4535ee82b9cb59ebf3ed177be5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 21:44:17.000000000', 'message': 'Properly handle unicode headers.

Fix unicode handling in Python 3 and Python 2. There are currently two
failure modes. In python 2, swiftclient fails to log in debug mode if
the account name has a non-ASCII character. This is because the account
name will appear in the storage URL, which we attempt to pass to the
logger as a byte string (whereas it should be a unicode string).

The second failure mode is with Python 3, where http_lib returns headers
that are latin-1 encoded, but swiftclient expects UTF-8. The patch
automatically converts headers from latin-1 (iso-8859-1) to UTF-8, so
that we can properly handle non-ASCII headers in responses.

Change-Id: Ifa7f3d5af71bde8127129f1f8603772d80d063c1
'}, {'created': '2018-04-18 18:51:51.000000000', 'message': 'Properly handle unicode headers.

Fix unicode handling in Python 3 and Python 2. There are currently two
failure modes. In python 2, swiftclient fails to log in debug mode if
the account name has a non-ASCII character. This is because the account
name will appear in the storage URL, which we attempt to pass to the
logger as a byte string (whereas it should be a unicode string). This
patch changes the behavior to convert the path strings into unicode by
calling the parse_header_string() function.

The second failure mode is with Python 3, where http_lib returns headers
that are latin-1 encoded, but swiftclient expects UTF-8. The patch
automatically converts headers from latin-1 (iso-8859-1) to UTF-8, so
that we can properly handle non-ASCII headers in responses.

Change-Id: Ifa7f3d5af71bde8127129f1f8603772d80d063c1
'}, {'created': '2018-07-20 19:38:52.000000000', 'message': 'Properly handle unicode headers.

Fix unicode handling in Python 3 and Python 2. There are currently two
failure modes. In python 2, swiftclient fails to log in debug mode if
the account name has a non-ASCII character. This is because the account
name will appear in the storage URL, which we attempt to pass to the
logger as a byte string (whereas it should be a unicode string). This
patch changes the behavior to convert the path strings into unicode by
calling the parse_header_string() function.

The second failure mode is with Python 3, where http_lib returns headers
that are latin-1 encoded, but swiftclient expects UTF-8. The patch
automatically converts headers from latin-1 (iso-8859-1) to UTF-8, so
that we can properly handle non-ASCII headers in responses.

Change-Id: Ifa7f3d5af71bde8127129f1f8603772d80d063c1
'}, {'created': '2018-07-23 18:24:57.000000000', 'message': 'Properly handle unicode headers.

Fix unicode handling in Python 3 and Python 2. There are currently two
failure modes. In python 2, swiftclient fails to log in debug mode if
the account name has a non-ASCII character. This is because the account
name will appear in the storage URL, which we attempt to pass to the
logger as a byte string (whereas it should be a unicode string). This
patch changes the behavior to convert the path strings into unicode by
calling the parse_header_string() function.

The second failure mode is with Python 3, where http_lib returns headers
that are latin-1 encoded, but swiftclient expects UTF-8. The patch
automatically converts headers from latin-1 (iso-8859-1) to UTF-8, so
that we can properly handle non-ASCII headers in responses.

Change-Id: Ifa7f3d5af71bde8127129f1f8603772d80d063c1

patch changes the behavior to convert the path strings into unicode by
calling the parse_header_string() function.

The second failure mode is with Python 3, where http_lib returns headers
that are latin-1 encoded, but swiftclient expects UTF-8. The patch

commit_message:
Properly handle unicode headers.

Fix unicode handling in Python 3 and Python 2. There are currently two
failure modes. In python 2, swiftclient fails to log in debug mode if
the account name has a non-ASCII character. This is because the account
name will appear in the storage URL, which we attempt to pass to the
logger as a byte string (whereas it should be a unicode string). This
patch changes the behavior to convert the path strings into unicode by
calling the parse_header_string() function.

The second failure mode is with Python 3, where http_lib returns headers
that are latin-1 encoded, but swiftclient expects UTF-8. The patch
automatically converts headers from latin-1 (iso-8859-1) to UTF-8, so
that we can properly handle non-ASCII headers in responses.

Change-Id: Ifa7f3d5af71bde8127129f1f8603772d80d063c1

[{'created': '2018-07-13 14:33:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fluent-logging: Update tests and template job

This updates the helm tests and the elasticsearch template job.
This changes the tests to conditionally check whether the
template job is enabled and the templates key is not empty, and
uses the result to determine whether to test for the existence
of those templates (to account for situations where the job is
disabled).

This updates the job to also check whether there are templates
defined in additional to checking whether the job itself is
enabled.

Change-Id: I14cedeb8d8a4444a73ea974426c3b0f136d1b698
'}]
commit_message:
Fluent-logging: Update tests and template job

This updates the helm tests and the elasticsearch template job.
This changes the tests to conditionally check whether the
template job is enabled and the templates key is not empty, and
uses the result to determine whether to test for the existence
of those templates (to account for situations where the job is
disabled).

This updates the job to also check whether there are templates
defined in additional to checking whether the job itself is
enabled.

Change-Id: I14cedeb8d8a4444a73ea974426c3b0f136d1b698

zfsonlinux uses sudo to kill the process so remove
it from the rootwrap filter.

Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add missing `--public` option to workbook api

Handle `scope` parameter in workbook api with `private`
as default value
Add `--public` option to workbook create/update commands
Add `Scope` column to the output of workbook commands

Change-Id: I5c9b107127afd55757fe9e815eff5b30e48fccac
Closes-Bug: 1782790

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Id348ed0c3cb16637990acfa6aaf529cf2567de9a

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ib4c7bb59c92946c3e8b257cbf1ce2f44cb1c40ed

commit_message:
Graph fast fail-over

* Initialize quickly upon fail-over without requesting updates.
* In case of downtime, Vitrage-graph startup will requests collector updates
* vitrage-persistor has an expirer timer to remove old db events

Story: 2002663
Task: 22473
Change-Id: Icccf230e69c41a2f115c0797e60df774db637594
Depends-On: I042665e0d642ba36a97af84a6dc0581888025207
Depends-On: Id5dbd165a1e0220e4e24207e8d237f94415fc490

commit_message:
Use json.loads instead of eval() on the config

eval isn't safe or secure and shouldn't ever be used in this situation.
We can possibly use oslo.config for this, so this is only a partial fix
but might be good enough. This change removes a security issue.

Partial-Bug: #1783293
Change-Id: Id5c02d92ad7335c3d7d42ac353b88376cdb704fb

commit_message:
check file existance and permission for a nodepool private key

* Check the file existence and permission for a nodepool private
  key will help to avoid ssh permission denied issue.

Closes-Bug: #1783310
Change-Id: I213dbe2713d7c946c2be4a60c424f843dd8591c9

Can you clarify the development process for this?  Obviously much of this change needs to land in neutron-lib so that other networking projects can comply with it.  Is your goal to get this working here, and then to spin a neutron-lib patch and remove the parts of this that are moving to neutron-lib?  Until this is in neutron-lib, how do you expect other projects that plug in to the neutron API (like neutron-fwaas for example) to react to the filtering validation?  If this will break those projects, then something needs to be added to the release notes noting that this feature must be disabled for those projects.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-07-03 17:07:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Can you clarify the development process for this?  Obviously much
 > of this change needs to land in neutron-lib so that other
 > networking projects can comply with it.  Is your goal to get this

All the changes have already landed on neutron-lib 1.17.0

 > working here, and then to spin a neutron-lib patch and remove the
 > parts of this that are moving to neutron-lib?  Until this is in

Are you describing the on-going effort to re-home API definition to neutron-lib? It seems to me that the API definition rehome is a parallel effort of this effort.

 > neutron-lib, how do you expect other projects that plug in to the
 > neutron API (like neutron-fwaas for example) to react to the
 > filtering validation?  If this will break those projects, then

Theoretically, all out-of-tree plugins (i.e. fwaas) have this feature disabled by default, so they should not break. If out-of-tree plugins want to enable validation, they need to make sure things won't break before turning it on.

 > something needs to be added to the release notes noting that this
 > feature must be disabled for those projects.

OK, I can add more details about that."}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-07-03 17:27:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

'}, {'created': '2018-07-03 15:39:51.000000000', 'message': "Implement filter validation

Enforce validation on filter parameters on list requests.
If an API request contains an unknown or unsupported parameter,
the server will return a 400 response instead of silently ignoring
the invalid input.

In resource attributes map, all filter parameters are annotated by
the ``is_filter`` keyword. Attributes with is_filter set to True
are candidates for validation.

The support of filter validation might vary across plugins so each
plugin need to indicate if it supports the validation by setting
``__filter_validation_support`` to True. If this field is not set,
the default is False and validation is turned off for that plugin.
Right now, all neutron in-tree plugins support filter validation.
Out-of-tree plugins will have filter validation disabled by default.

An API extension is introduced to allow API users to discover this
new API behavior. This feature can be disabled by cloud operators
if they choose to do that. If it is disabled, the extension won't
be presented.

Depends-On: Ic3ab5b3ffdc378d570678b9c967cb42b0c7a8a9b
Depends-On: I4397df1c35463a8b532afdc9c5d28b37224a37b4

commit_message:
Implement filter validation

Enforce validation on filter parameters on list requests.
If an API request contains an unknown or unsupported parameter,
the server will return a 400 response instead of silently ignoring
the invalid input.

In resource attributes map, all filter parameters are annotated by
the ``is_filter`` keyword. Attributes with is_filter set to True
are candidates for validation.

Enabling filter validation requires support from core plugin and
all service plugins so each plugin need to indicate if it supports
the validation by setting ``__filter_validation_support`` to True.
If this field is not set, the default is False and validation is
turned off. Right now, the ML2 plugin and all the in-tree service
plugin support filter validation. Out-of-tree plugins will have
filter validation disabled by default.

An API extension is introduced to allow API users to discover this
new API behavior. This feature can be disabled by cloud operators
if they choose to do that. If it is disabled, the extension won't
be presented.

Depends-On: Ic3ab5b3ffdc378d570678b9c967cb42b0c7a8a9b
Depends-On: I4397df1c35463a8b532afdc9c5d28b37224a37b4
Depends-On: I3f2e6e861adaeef81a1a5819a57b28f5c6281d80
Depends-On: I1189bc9a50308df5c7e18c329f3a1262c90b9e12
Depends-On: I057cd917628c77dd20c0ff7747936c3fec7b4844

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit bfb9d3f179607c25f91d77585f97df6d0704c253'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-24 15:02:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Sounds like this does make a noticeable difference at large scale:

(9:58:01 AM) s10: mriedem: about https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bug/1737465+(status:open+OR+status:merged).
(9:58:02 AM) s10: mriedem: i've tested this patches in our small testing environment with Pike. I created one fake nova-compute with 10000 instances.
(9:58:02 AM) s10: mriedem: without any patches function _get_instances_by_host() for this fake host gets instances in 15 seconds, with merged patch (569218) ? in 8 seconds, with the last patch (569247, Trim the fat on HostState.instances) ? in 5 seconds.
(9:58:02 AM) s10: mriedem: for other hosts speed increase are comparable, 0.05-0.10 seconds per host becomes 0.02-0.04, depending on the number of instances.

Granted, you're not going to have 10K instances on a single compute host."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-17 18:42:40.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid unnecessary joins in HostManager._get_instances_by_host

While getting a HostState object for a given compute node during
scheduling, if the HostState does not have its instance info
set, either because it's out of date or because config option
"track_instance_changes" is False, the HostManager still pulls
the list of instances for that host from the database and stores
it in HostState.instances.

This is *only* used (in-tree) by the affinity filters and even
then the only thing those filters use from HostState.instances
is the set of keys from the dict, which is the list of instance
UUIDs on a given host. The actual Instance objects aren't used
at all. See blueprint put-host-manager-instance-info-on-a-diet
for more details on that.

The point of this change, is that when we go to pull the set
of instances from the database for a given host, we don't need
to join on the default columns (info_cache and security_groups)
defined in the _instance_get_all_query() method in the DB API.

This should be at least some minor optimization in scheduling
for hosts that have several instances on them in a large cloud.

A more impactful change would be to refactor
HostManager._get_host_states to bulk query the instances on
the given set of compute nodes in a single query per cell. But
that is left for a later change.

Change-Id: Iccefbfdfa578515a004ef6ac718bac1a49d5c5fd
Partial-Bug: #1737465

then the only thing those filters use from HostState.instances

for hosts that have several instances on them in a large cloud.

per instance, but we have no contract on out of tree filters

commit_message:
Avoid unnecessary joins in HostManager._get_instances_by_host

While getting a HostState object for a given compute node during
scheduling, if the HostState does not have its instance info
set, either because it's out of date or because config option
"track_instance_changes" is False, the HostManager still pulls
the list of instances for that host from the database and stores
it in HostState.instances.

This is *only* used (in-tree) by the affinity filters and even
then the only thing those filters use from HostState.instances
is the set of keys from the dict, which is the list of instance
UUIDs on a given host. The actual Instance objects aren't used
at all. See blueprint put-host-manager-instance-info-on-a-diet
for more details on that.

The point of this change, is that when we go to pull the set
of instances from the database for a given host, we don't need
to join on the default columns (info_cache and security_groups)
defined in the _instance_get_all_query() method in the DB API.

This should be at least some minor optimization in scheduling
for hosts that have several instances on them in a large cloud.
As noted in the comment in the code, any out of tree filters
that rely on using the info_cache or security_groups from the
instance are now going to be hit with a lazy-load penalty
per instance, but we have no contract on out of tree filters
so if this happens, the people maintaining said filters can
(1) live with it (2) fork the HostManager code or (3) upstream
their filter so it's in-tree.

A more impactful change would be to refactor
HostManager._get_host_states to bulk query the instances on
the given set of compute nodes in a single query per cell. But
that is left for a later change.

Change-Id: Iccefbfdfa578515a004ef6ac718bac1a49d5c5fd
Partial-Bug: #1737465

commit_message:
Improve pep8 checking along with hacking

This change will help to check the function _() is
used but not imported. And the gates will check this missing
in the next time.

Co-authored-By: Nguyen Van Trung <trungnv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: Icb40b3af9922e551f06cfd18de26dfcce9960d5a

[{'created': '2018-04-23 17:16:49.000000000', 'message': 'Use ansible_queue_name only for upgrade/update

For upgrade and update nodes with ansible, we do not
need to play with both queue: tripleo and upgrade queue.
If we use both, we can have race where the both can have
different status and we enter in an infinite loop while
reading the socker.

Change-Id: I484a3af4a830af3b97231558876d9a6c0a31e603
(cherry picked from commit 61dfe32a2a72e5341575ecaa2762f889a2d30e46)
'}]
commit_message:
Use ansible_queue_name only for upgrade/update

For upgrade and update nodes with ansible, we do not
need to play with both queue: tripleo and upgrade queue.
If we use both, we can have race where the both can have
different status and we enter in an infinite loop while
reading the socker.

Change-Id: I484a3af4a830af3b97231558876d9a6c0a31e603
(cherry picked from commit 61dfe32a2a72e5341575ecaa2762f889a2d30e46)

[{'account_id': 9139, 'date': '2018-07-18 18:11:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-07-19 06:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Why are you doing this?

What is the advantage of this new one?'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-07-19 08:40:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

When I see web pages on as-is and the patch, does it seem that some detail content parts on search results are deleted on this patch? (screenshot on as-is: https://prnt.sc/k8bklr and your patch: https://prnt.sc/k8bkva )'}, {'account_id': 10278, 'date': '2018-07-19 14:28:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

To add some context here, Swifttype was a 3rd party service that decided to raise their rates by 300%.  The Foundation could no longer afford to pay for their search tool, so we used SOLR to replace it. 

To Ian's point, initially, it won't be as feature rich because it won't search all of our *.openstack.org properties at once. However, we are working on some new options, pending future development cycles/time."}, {'account_id': 9139, 'date': '2018-07-20 04:03:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-07-22 08:08:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-07-23 05:23:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Thank u for explaining this point + the background of this patch!

 > won't search all of our *.openstack.org properties at once.
 > However, we are working on some new options, pending future
 > development cycles/time."}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-07-23 05:24:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Q: Does this patch have dependency on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583713/ ?'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-07-23 05:25:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Nope (self-answer)

 > Q: Does this patch have dependency on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583713/

commit_message:
Add pycadf initiator for flask resource

Add a pycadf initiator property for the flask resource
base. This allows for generation of a proper initiator
where needed in Keystone APIs.

Change-Id: Iaa3dd134cc2feb39918015b5d2d8891e47362dce
Partial-Bug: #1776504

commit_message:
Merge server create for keypair extension

As nova extensions has been deprecated already and goal is to
merge all scattered code into main controller side.
Currently schema and request/response extended code are there
among all extensions.

This commit merge the server_create for keypair extensions.

Partially implements: blueprint api-extensions-merge-rocky

Change-Id: I6b5b597a263ff61e90871121c14dfc141c2fef0f

commit_message:
Remove EXPERIMENTAL warning for manila docker deployments

These warnings should be present through stable/pike
but not thereafter since starting in stable/queens
containerized deployment of manila is supported.

Change-Id: Ib54cba0d336bde11af2adc3968e8ce8a6663aeff
(cherry picked from commit 91b92ddc0dfe76e9a7d345cb83db775251ea8c36)

[{'created': '2018-07-24 10:44:47.000000000', 'message': 'kolla-toolbox: fix os_config_client path for Debian

(venv-for-kolla) 12:04 (438s) linaro@c1n1:kolla$ docker run -it -u root haerwu/debian-source-kolla-toolbox:6.0.0 bash
()[root@f93a6cc8afb2 /]# find / -name defaults.json
/opt/ansible/lib/python2.7/site-packages/openstack/config/defaults.json
/opt/ansible/lib/python2.7/site-packages/os_client_config/defaults.json

And we were looking at wrong path:

Change-Id: I4fd403f0f0cff0628e93872d9f0d2f56591980f9
00:33:42.029 ERROR:kolla.common.utils.kolla-toolbox:The command '/bin/sh -c pip --no-cache-dir install --upgrade ansible==2.2.0.0 MySQL-python os-client-config==1.29.0 pbr==4.0.0 pymongo python-openstackclient==3.14.0 pytz pyudev shade==1.27.1     && mkdir -p /etc/ansible /usr/share/ansible     && echo 'localhost ansible_connection=local ansible_python_interpreter=/opt/ansible/bin/python' > /etc/ansible/hosts     && sed -i 's|  "identity_api_version": "2.0",|  "identity_api_version": "3",|' /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/os_client_config/defaults.json' returned a non-zero code: 2
00:33:42.029 INFO:kolla.common.utils:Attempt number: 2 to run task: BuildTask(kolla-toolbox)
(cherry picked from commit 750a012d05a49a64f611633b9b37ef4f417deb35)
'}]
commit_message:
kolla-toolbox: fix os_config_client path for Debian

(venv-for-kolla) 12:04 (438s) linaro@c1n1:kolla$ docker run -it -u root haerwu/debian-source-kolla-toolbox:6.0.0 bash
()[root@f93a6cc8afb2 /]# find / -name defaults.json

Looks like the best option for now.'}, {'account_id': 7979, 'date': '2018-07-23 15:31:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

thanks, this also fixes IBM PowerKVM CI https://dal05.objectstorage.softlayer.net/v1/AUTH_3d8e6ecb-f597-448c-8ec2-164e9f710dd6/pkvmci/requirements/81/584881/1/check-silent/tempest-dsvm-full-xenial/cf3cc85/'}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-07-23 15:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-23 15:46:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Signs point to gcc bug and not a bug with eventlet itself?'}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-07-23 18:18:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

greenlet, not eventlet. And it seems to me like it's their bug to fix, whether or not there is a related gcc bug, since a) their change exposed this and b) the chance of getting a gcc fix backported to all relevant OSes is probably slim to none. But maybe I'm just being pessimistic on that last point. I'm trying to open an Ubuntu bug."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-23 18:21:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Can nova just blacklist greenlet 0.4.14 for now?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-07-23 18:28:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree with Matthew E, seems like something they should resolve on their end before we allow picking it up.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-23 19:54:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Related nova blacklist to unblock powerkvm and powervm CI for nova:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585016/'}, {'account_id': 16710, 'date': '2018-07-23 20:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-07-23 20:56:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I guess we can't exclude package versions per-project:

http://logs.openstack.org/16/585016/1/check/requirements-check/bcf8308/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-23_20_29_46_055397"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-24 03:00:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

If 0.4.14 is bad we want to make sure we don't re-add this to u-c.  We also want projects (nova) to be able to add explicit exclusions to do that we need to also ban the broken version in global-requirements."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-24 03:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-24 03:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-24 03:17:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm still not sure about this, if this is a gcc bug then that's the proper place to fix it.  Will this issue persist in 0.4.15?"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-24 03:31:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I'm still not sure about this, if this is a gcc bug then that's the
 > proper place to fix it.  Will this issue persist in 0.4.15?

I can't predict the future but I feel the correct fix is to revert https://github.com/python-greenlet/greenlet/pull/130/commits/9c8a65fddcffe161f38679a0b3289de9b25e2bc6

which I'm pretty sure is incorrect given ELFv1 wasn't ever a supported std. on ppc64le.

I will however leave that to IBM to pursue.  In the short term I think blocking 0.4.14 is a reasonable thing to do given it introduces regressions."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-07-24 03:44:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I'll leave my vote as just as +1 then.  I'm still not fully convinced this is the proper fix or that upstream will actually care about that old gcc version (they didn't seem to be in the linked issue).  So I think we may eventually have to block 0.4.15 and so on."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-24 03:53:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I'll leave my vote as just as +1 then.  I'm still not fully
 > convinced this is the proper fix or that upstream will actually
 > care about that old gcc version (they didn't seem to be in the
 > linked issue).  So I think we may eventually have to block 0.4.15
 > and so on.

Fair enough.

I think that blocking 0.4.14 gives us time to evaluate and hopefully get greenlet fixed, I'm still pretty sure that PR130 is wrong and needs a rework (given I committed the initial ppc64le code in https://github.com/tbreeds/greenlet/commit/9ad99fb5b9db916ca81bd3f5717c67e20384f7e0
I'm not completely making this up ;P)"}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-07-24 06:35:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-07-24 10:23:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Drop greenlet u-c back to 0.4.13

The greenlet 0.4.14 release has a bug [1] that breaks at least the
PowerVM CI, and probably a lot more. Dropping u-c back to 0.4.13 to
avoid this issue.

[1] https://github.com/python-greenlet/greenlet/issues/136

Change-Id: I6e81e5a7c384ec273ff4c4665f7df44192707814

commit_message:
Replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url"

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url".

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: I50c73d7529527ded0a71d6ab1d62fc2197c3acb9

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I6484b605b1a7b8bcc4589170d2645f7cb0ca66f6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 11:06:01.000000000', 'message': "Fix rspec test on ubuntu os.

There seems to be an issue with rspec-puppet where it doesn't have the
necessary facts for getting the right initsystem on debian's like
os[1].  It may then happen that it detects a runit system and
obviously fails on service checks.

We force that fact to systemd as this is true for all supported os.

[1] https://github.com/rodjek/rspec-puppet/issues/629

Change-Id: I8b406c33ae8467d54f1b8502fbde5dfd1fbb1204
Closes-Bug: #1783302
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rspec test on ubuntu os.

There seems to be an issue with rspec-puppet where it doesn't have the
necessary facts for getting the right initsystem on debian's like
os[1].  It may then happen that it detects a runit system and
obviously fails on service checks.

We force that fact to systemd as this is true for all supported os.

[1] https://github.com/rodjek/rspec-puppet/issues/629

Change-Id: I8b406c33ae8467d54f1b8502fbde5dfd1fbb1204
Closes-Bug: #1783302

commit_message:
Revert "Add networking-odl image to skipped image list"

This reverts commit I57594742e0842c0e701b9974046d9d1704446f4b

Add ceilometer package into neutron-server-opendaylight container, then
it chould be found by pip.

commit_message:
Remove testrepository and .testr.conf

This commit is a follow-up of "switch to using stestr"
which was merged already [1].
After switch to using stestr, testrepository and .testr.conf
are unnecessary and should be removed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571947

Change-Id: I17b8e906c2b7307252b6e0d9d81661016ce50e91

commit_message:
Take nodes out of TOCI_JOBTYPE

Handle logic for nodes independently, loading it from the job
config. Now the noop cases can be removed from the case loop as
*) is gone. Keep the rest of toci_jobtype as-is.

Change-Id: I44b703575059c6c09ccd76adb15709c288b7ff87

subject: Add py36 testenv
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 11:53:38.000000000', 'message': "Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/8/goals/stein/python3-first.rst@42

Change-Id: If563a5abc3580629abf38df0885322ee69e35a74
"}]
commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/8/goals/stein/python3-first.rst@42

Change-Id: If563a5abc3580629abf38df0885322ee69e35a74

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-11 03:52:02.000000000', 'message': "Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ibbad6f4e63efbef4e2e144f3ba4218ce6579371a

commit_message:
block-device lvm: fix umount phase

As described in blockdevice.py detachment and (most) resources
release must be done in the umount phase of a block device module.

Until now these jobs were done in the lvm cleanup() phase - which
is too late - especially when using nested LVMs.

This patch moves the functionality of the cleanup() phase to the
umount() phase for the lvm module.
It includes a test case that fails without applying the provided
source code changes.

Change-Id: I697bfbf042816c5ddf170bde9534cc4f0c7279ff
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
Use oslo_serialization.jsonutils

Keystone's objects have a number of data types that do not serialize
cleanly with the defualt stdlib json library. This change makes
Keystone utilize oslo_serialization.jsonutils instead with flask
restful.

Change-Id: I6c070b5e7bb231fca47f10bfaaa989072d2dd092
Partial-Bug: #1776504

commit_message:
Fix confusing log message in scheduler

Not having enough resources for creating the instance is a lot more
probable reason for no allocation candidates than compute node is just
starting up. This patch changes the log message to state both reasons.

Change-Id: I5d0cefbf833e797d560e115148beae35b0c48959
Closes-Bug: #1782309

[{'created': '2017-11-15 07:04:03.000000000', 'message': "Add extra_msg and server parameter to check_vm_connectivity

Now manager.check_public_network_connectivity just adds log ex_msg
and log console output based on check_vm_connectivity, and the same
helper name also exists in TestNetworkBasicOps, so this is to:
1. add extra_msg and server parameter to manager.check_vm_connectivity, so
   it can log extra_msg and log console output.
2. add server parameter to manager.ping_ip_address, so it can log console
   output for the specific server while not self.servers, because in its
   use cases only the server owning the ip address is needed for console output.
3. add underscore before TestNetworkBasicOps.check_public_network_connectivity
   because it is an internal helper, and replace its calling super's
   check_public_network_connectivity with calling self.check_vm_connectivity
4. remove manager.check_public_network_connectivity

Change-Id: Ibe8966cabbb2c9264640ba3f559a0146be588aa0

commit_message:
Add extra_msg and server parameter to check_vm_connectivity

Now manager.check_public_network_connectivity just adds log ex_msg
and log console output based on check_vm_connectivity, and the same
helper name also exists in TestNetworkBasicOps, so this is to:
1. add extra_msg and server parameter to manager.check_vm_connectivity, so
   it can log extra_msg and log console output.
2. add server parameter to manager.ping_ip_address, so it can log console
   output for the specific server while not self.servers, because in its
   use cases only the server owning the ip address is needed for console output.
3. add underscore before TestNetworkBasicOps.check_public_network_connectivity
   because it is an internal helper, and replace its calling super's
   check_public_network_connectivity with calling self.check_vm_connectivity
4. remove manager.check_public_network_connectivity

Change-Id: Ibe8966cabbb2c9264640ba3f559a0146be588aa0

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ie726a4b47b3df701fffc27fda14573bd459d2fbe

commit_message:
Add iterations to service tests

* Add iterations to test_pod_service_http and test_lb_service_http so
  two subsequent requests that happens to be to the same pod won't
  fail
* remove test_service_curl
* Changing the name of test_pod_service_curl and test_lb_service_curl

Change-Id: I148e5c1af49c68d096617978a6cdffe2c29c5fe0

commit_message:
Update tacker CLI to openstack CLI in tacker demo

- Change to openstack CLI
- Change the way to run demo from "sh" to "./" for
matching with README.rst in tacker demo folder.

Change-Id: I17b755cd8d52f594785ef13634bfa233e63841a7

subject: [DNM] don't enable epel in centos
messages:
[{'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-07-16 11:01:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28595, 'date': '2018-07-16 18:53:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I understand your use case (i have the same in a corporate environment) but I think it brakes the out of the box kolla behavior. Maybe you can override the "base_centos_yum_repo_packages" variable, or include epel in base image repository (like the unfluxdb.repo by exemple) instead of installing the "epel-release" package'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-07-24 10:14:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I understand your use case (i have the same in a corporate
 > environment) but I think it brakes the out of the box kolla
 > behavior. Maybe you can override the "base_centos_yum_repo_packages"
 > variable, or include epel in base image repository (like the
 > unfluxdb.repo by exemple) instead of installing the "epel-release"
 > package

sure will check that'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-07-24 10:15:06.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

will resume later on this.'}]
